0.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases as 20,044 new cases reported?
0.article_body: West Bengal has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases at 30,043 as the country reported 20,044 new cases in the last 24 hours. It is followed by Kerala (24,953), Tamil Nadu (17,487), Maharashtra (16,000) and Karnataka (6,702). Active cases in the country stand at 1,40,760, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,660.

1.title: Russian space agency chief Dmitry, known for clashes with Musk, fired
1.article_body: Dmitry Rogozin, the Russian space agency chief who had frequent clashes online with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, has been fired. While Kremlin did not provide a reason for removing him, Rogozin’s exit occurred on the same day that NASA and Roscosmos reached terms on a new agreement to collaborate on International Space Station missions despite the ongoing situation in Ukraine.

2.title: Elected govts are toppled for not accepting BJP's ideology: NCP chief
2.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday accused BJP-led central leadership of imposing their ideology on state governments run by non-BJP parties. He alleged that democratically elected governments in states are toppled if they don't accept BJP's ideology. "But such things do not last...wherever autocracy took over in the world, it didn't last long," he told a gathering of NCP workers.

3.title: Traffic curbs issued in Secunderabad for Ujjaini Mahakali Bonalu festival
3.article_body: Hyderabad City Police has issued traffic restrictions in view of Ujjaini Mahakali Bonalu festival on July 17 and 18 in Secunderabad. Motorists have been asked to avoid stretches and junctions in the two-kilometre radius of Sri Ujjaini Mahakali Temple. Police further asked people to avoid roads and junctions of Karbala Maidan, Ranigunj, Bible house and Ramgopalpet.

4.title: Pakistani woman crosses LoC at night in J&K's Poonch, arrested
4.article_body: A 49-year-old Pakistani woman was arrested by the Indian Army after she crossed the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Friday night, officials said. The woman, Rozina, is a resident of Pakistan's Islamabad, the officials added. Earlier this month, the BSF handed over a three-year-old Pakistani boy to his family after he inadvertently entered India.

5.title: Smartwatch-like wearable that operates without a battery developed in US
5.article_body: Researchers at the University of California, Irvine, have developed a smartwatch-like wearable that can operate without an external power source or a battery. The 3D printed device is capable of keeping a track of the wearer's pulse and communicating wirelessly with a nearby smartphone. It uses an ultra-thin 2D material called MXene, which has unique electrical and mechanical properties.

6.title: 'No prayers permitted' sign put up at Lulu mall in UP after men seen offering namaz
6.article_body: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall in UP's Lucknow has put up a sign stating 'No religious prayers will be permitted in the mall'. This comes as police filed an FIR after a video showed some men offering namaz inside the newly opened mall. Meanwhile, police on Friday detained three people for attempting to recite Sundarkand at the mall.

7.title: Infosys Science Foundation opens first office in Bengaluru
7.article_body: The Infosys Science Foundation, the not-for-profit Trust set up in 2009 by IT major Infosys, inaugurated its first office in Bengaluru's Jayanagar on Thursday. The opening ceremony was attended by Infosys Co-founders Narayana Murthy and Kris Gopalakrishnan. "This building has offices for ISF professionals, several conference rooms, a 100-seater technology-enabled auditorium," said Murthy.

8.title: Don't like my songs in other films, will take legal route next time: Rajiv Rai
8.article_body: Director Rajiv Rai said that he will take the legal route next time his songs are being recreated and used in another movie. "I do not like people putting my songs in other films...The problem is when you take a piece from say 'Mohra' and put it in another film and then claim that it's yours," he added.

9.title: 150 students fall sick after eating lunch at IIIT-Basar hostel in Telangana
9.article_body: Nearly 150 students of the Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies, also known as IIIT-Basar in Telangana's Nirmal district, fell sick after they ate lunch at the hostel on Friday. "All students are stable now...600 students had lunch on the campus," Telangana Minister Indrakaran Reddy said. As many as 23 students were shifted to a hospital, he added.

10.title: Arjun's 'Kuttey' to clash with Katrina's 'Phone Bhoot' on November 4
10.article_body: Arjun Kapoor's upcoming film 'Kuttey' is set to clash with Katrina Kaif, Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi-starrer 'Phone Bhoot' on November 4. 'Kuttey', which also stars Konkona Sensharma, Naseeruddin Shah, Kumud Mishra, Radhika Madan and Tabu, is being directed by Aasmaan Bhardwaj. Meanwhile, 'Phone Bhoot' is a horror comedy directed by Gurmmeet Singh.

11.title: You need to make tough decisions: Hogg on Kohli's selection for T20 WC
11.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's potential selection in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "You need to make tough decisions." "The game has been more aggressive. You're scoring at higher rates and taking on the bowling...There are a few decisions that India [have] to make," he added. "You pick your best XI for the...team," stated Hogg.

12.title: Join our Look Good Feel Good initiative: Raymond
12.article_body: Raymond believes that giving never goes out of style which is why it's always the season of giving at Raymond. Customers can pledge their pre-owned garments to the underprivileged and there will be a special gift for them in the store, like complimentary vouchers for trouser stitching. "Join our initiative to make millions smile," it stated.

13.title: Award-winning Dr. Soni suggests Get Slim Juice for weight loss: Kapiva
13.article_body: 90% of Get Slim Juice users claimed that the juice helps with weight loss, reduces cravings, and improves energy levels, shared Kapiva Ayurveda. Dr. Kriti Soni, R&D Head, Kapiva, also shared that the combination of 12 Ayurvedic herbs effectively boosts metabolism and reduces fat accumulation. To support this, Kapiva also provides a free diet and yoga plan with doctor consultation.

14.title: World's biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea fires 20% staff citing 'crypto winter'
14.article_body: The world's first and biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea has fired 20% of its employees citing "cryptocurrency winter" and "broad macroeconomic instability". CEO Devin Finzer shared the news on Twitter and said the affected employees will be provided with a generous severance and healthcare coverage into 2023. He added that the company will also help in the placement of these employees.

15.title: Consider adoption: HC to woman seeking to terminate 23-week pregnancy
15.article_body: Delhi HC on Friday said that it will not permit a 25-year-old unmarried woman to undergo termination of her 23-week pregnancy. It asked the woman to consider delivering the child who can be given up for adoption. "We will ensure...the girl is kept somewhere safe and she can deliver and go. There is a big queue for adoption," HC stated.

16.title: Waterbomber pilot dies fighting Portugal wildfire after plane crash
16.article_body: A pilot died on Friday after his waterbomber aircraft crashed while trying to contain a raging wildfire in northern Portugal, authorities said. The wildfire in Torre de Moncorvo is one of nine blazes sweeping across Portugal amid a heatwave. The fires have burnt more than 30,000 hectares of land so far this year, according to Portuguese state television RTP.

17.title: Boris Johnson said 'back anyone for UK PM but Rishi Sunak': Report
17.article_body: Amid the process to choose UK's next Prime Minister, caretaker Prime Minister Boris Johnson reportedly told his allies to "back anyone but Rishi Sunak". The five remaining Conservative candidates to become Britain's next PM include Sunak, Penny Mordaunt, Liz Truss, Kemi Badenoch and Tom Tugendhat. Sunak was the winner of the first two rounds of voting.

18.title: 7-yr-old boy dies as part of roof collapses in Raj amid heavy rainfall
18.article_body: A seven-year-old boy lost his life after a part of a house roof collapsed in Rajasthan's Ganganagar amid heavy rainfall. The authorities have advised people to not move out of their homes. Reports said that extremely heavy rainfall of 260 mm was recorded in Ganganagar in 24 hours ending 8.30 am on Friday.

19.title: 5 of family arrested in Faridabad for defrauding over 200 with fake gold items
19.article_body: Five members of a family were arrested by the Faridabad Police for allegedly defrauding over 200 people across India by selling them fake gold coins, ornaments and others. The family, which lived in Ballabgarh, used to claim the fake items as "Mughal-era artifacts" that were unearthed during excavations. The accused had made crores of rupees through this racket, police said.

20.title: Signed 'Mirzapur' after reading 2 episodes: Shweta Tripathi Sharma
20.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma has said she doesn't do projects for money, adding, "I did 'Mirzapur' after reading two episodes, out of which my character was not even there in the first episode." The actress, who plays a character named Golu on the show, added that she just wanted to be a part of the world that was created.

21.title: Ricky Martin accused of having sexual relation with 21-year-old nephew
21.article_body: Singer Ricky Martin has been accused of having a sexual relationship with his 21-year-old nephew, who allegedly earlier accused him of domestic violence. Martin faces up to 50 years in jail in Puerto Rico, according to reports. Martin's lawyer denied the allegations, saying the idea of having sexual or romantic relationship with his nephew isn't only untrue but also "disgusting".

22.title: Sanjay said, 'You're woking out in gym for 2 yrs, body doesn't show': Ranbir
22.article_body: At a 'Shamshera' event, actor Ranbir Kapoor said he used to work out in actor Sanjay Dutt's gym during 'Barfi' and 'Rockstar'. "He used to tell me, 'You are working out for the past two years, but your body doesn't show it'," Ranbir added. Ranbir further said that Dutt has always had his back and has always inspired him.

23.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Musk gets 90-min 1st court hearing on July 19
23.article_body: Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over terminating the $44 billion acquisition deal will be first heard in court on July 19. Kathaleen McCormick, the Chancellor of Delaware's Court of Chancery, has set a 90-minute hearing. Notably, Twitter has requested that the trial begins in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25.

24.title: Tried social media for 2 days, lost 5 years of my life: Shamshera maker
24.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera', said, "I tried [social media] for two...days and lost five years of my life." Discussing whether she could convince Ranbir to join Instagram, the film's actress Vaani Kapoor said, "He won't listen to me. [Director] Siddharth Anand came on social media during release of 'War' and deleted his account after its release."

25.title: Mumbai to get 5 new air quality monitors in 2022, locations to be decided
25.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install and operate five of its own Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Stations (CAAQMS) in the city by the end of 2022. "The locations of proposed monitors have not been decided but we will be installing them in places or wards which are not yet covered by the existing network," an official said.

26.title: US, Saudi Arabia agree on stopping Iran from getting nuclear weapon
26.article_body: The US and Saudi Arabia agreed on the importance of stopping Iran from "acquiring a nuclear weapon" during a visit by US President Joe Biden to the Arab nation, a joint statement read. Both countries also "underscored the need to further deter Iran's interference in...internal affairs of other countries, its support for terrorism...and its efforts to destabilise...the region", it added.

27.title: Tansa dam supplying drinking water to Mumbai full, public caution advised
27.article_body: Tansa dam, which is one of the seven reservoirs that supply drinking water to Mumbai, is full due to heavy rainfall, officials announced on Thursday. Public caution was also advised in view of the development. "We have warned the people residing downstream of the Tansa river about the possibility of rising water levels," Palghar District Collector Manik Gursal said.

28.title: Hyd police officer helps man who fell after getting electric shock
28.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Saturday said that a police constable, Abdul Khadeer, gave CPR to a 25-year-old man who fell after getting an electric shock while putting up a decorative arch at Secunderabad's Maisamma Temple. The man was then taken to a hospital where he received treatment before being discharged, police added. The incident occurred on Thursday, police further said.

29.title: Bengaluru Police conducts drive against begging, 43 rescued
29.article_body: Bengaluru Police, the Department of Women and Child Development and members of multiple NGOs jointly conducted a drive against begging at the city's traffic junctions on Friday. As many as 43 people, including 28 children and 15 mothers, found begging at the junctions were rescued. The rescued children were handed over to the Child Welfare Committee, said police.

30.title: Bodies of 2 school students found on railway tracks in UP's Gorakhpur
30.article_body: The bodies of two school students were found on the railway tracks in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, police said. The bodies are of a Class 12 student and a Class 11 student, and they both used to study in the same school, police added. Reportedly, both were having an affair and wanted to marry but their families were against it.

31.title: Organs of brain-dead woman save 5 lives, including 2 soldiers, in Pune
31.article_body: The organs of a 34-year-old woman, who was declared brain dead, saved five lives at Pune's Command Hospital on Thursday night. Her organs such as both kidneys were transplanted into two serving soldiers of the Indian Army, a hospital official said. Her liver was retrieved by a team of surgeons from Ruby Hall Clinic for a patient at their hospital.

32.title: Ireland record their highest-ever ODI total, lose 3rd ODI to New Zealand by 1 run
32.article_body: Ireland recorded their highest-ever total in ODI cricket by registering 359/9 while chasing a target of 361 against New Zealand in the third ODI in Dublin. Ireland lost the match by 1 run as New Zealand clinched the three-match series 3-0. Ireland's previous highest ODI total had come on March 7, 2015, when they scored 331/8 against Zimbabwe.

33.title: Hyd civic body to train unemployed youth from economically weaker sections
33.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has tied up with Lighthouse Communities Foundation (LCF) to provide skill development training to unemployed youth belonging to economically weaker sections. Under the programme, youth aged 18-35 years will be trained across various fields including IT, web designing and nursing. The initiative will be launched in Serilingampally Zone on pilot basis.

34.title: 21-yr-old student dies by suicide over fear of placement in Pune
34.article_body: A 21-year-old engineering student allegedly died by suicide by jumping from the eighth floor of a residential building in Pune on Friday. As per a purported suicide note, the deceased did so as he feared that he wouldn't get any job placement, police said. The deceased has been identified as a fourth-year student at a college in the city.

35.title: Maria Sharapova welcomes first child with fiancé; shares pic
35.article_body: Maria Sharapova took to social media to share the news of the birth of her son. The baby, named Theodore, is the first child of Sharapova and her fiancé Alexander Gilkes. The former world number one women's tennis player posted a picture and wrote, "The most beautiful, challenging, and rewarding gift our little family could ask for."

36.title: Murali creates history, becomes 1st Indian man to reach long jump final at World C'ships
36.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar has created history by becoming the first Indian man to qualify for the long jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 8m to reach the final at the 2022 World Athletics Championships in US' Eugene. Meanwhile, India's Avinash Sable qualified for the 3,000m steeplechase final.

37.title: Unjustifiable request: Musk files motion against Twitter's bid to fast-track trial
37.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has filed a motion opposing Twitter's request to fast-track a trial over the $44 billion deal, terming it an "unjustifiable request". While Twitter has requested the trial begin in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25, Musk has requested a trial date on or after February 13, 2023.

38.title: Ivana Trump died of accidental blunt impact injuries to torso: Medical examiner
38.article_body: Ivana Trump, former US President Donald Trump's first wife, died of "blunt impact injuries" to the torso, the New York City medical examiner's office has said. It added that the death of the 73-year-old was accidental. Reports in US media said that she died after falling down stairs in her New York City apartment.

39.title: No selector born in India yet who can drop Kohli: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif
39.article_body: On being asked if Virat Kohli should be dropped, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "There is no selector born in India yet who can drop Kohli." He also stated, "You are talking about one player, but the entire Indian team isn't winning consistently either. You are putting the gun on Virat's shoulders and keeping the other players safe."

40.title: Delhi businessman kills wife, 2 daughters and self over business loss
40.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman allegedly shot himself dead after killing his wife and two minor daughters over failure in business, police said. He was in jeans business and faced huge losses, police added. Before killing himself, the businessman made a video stating he killed his daughters since they would face problems in future but spared his sons because they would manage.

41.title: She didn't tell me she's dating Lalit Modi, got to know through media: Sushmita's father
41.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's father Shubeer Sen has said that he got to know that his daughter is dating former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi through media. "I had a telephonic conversation with her on Friday morning...but she did not tell me anything...I was informed after the tweet from Lalit Modi only by media persons," he added.

42.title: Doctor recommended cannabis use: Griner amid Russia drug trial
42.article_body: Jailed American basketball player Brittney Griner's lawyer has submitted to a Russian court a US doctor's note recommending the WNBA star use medical cannabis to treat pain. Griner was detained at Moscow airport in February after cannabis oil was allegedly found in her luggage. If found guilty of transporting drugs, she faces up to 10 years in a Russian jail.

43.title: Kerur violence victim's wife throws ₹2 lakh aid at Siddaramaiah's car
43.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave a compensation of ₹2 lakh to a woman whose husband was injured in the Kerur communal violence. However, the woman threw back the money at the Congress leader's car. The woman, identified as Mohammad Haneef's wife Rajma, said, "Today they'll give compensation and go away...My husband can't work for another year because of the assault."

44.title: Former Gambian spy chief sentenced to death
44.article_body: A court in Gambia has sentenced the country's former spy chief, Yankuba Badjie and four others to death for the killing of a political activist in 2016. Ebrima Solo Sandeng, an opposition party leader at the time, was killed at the intelligence agency's head office in the capital Banjul. Badjie was convicted along with four other former intelligence officials.

45.title: Putin reshuffles his senior ministers amid Ukraine war
45.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday reshuffled his senior ministers, removing the weapons industries charge from Deputy Prime Minister Yuri Borisov. This came amid reported flaws in Russian weaponry highlighted by the invasion of Ukraine. Denis Manturov was elevated to the rank of Deputy Prime Minister and will simultaneously handle the ministries of weapons industries and trade.

46.title: Wimbledon champ Rybakina to donate £2-mn prize money to juniors, animal charity
46.article_body: Elena Rybakina, who became the first Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam at Wimbledon 2022, said she would like to donate the majority of her £2 million prize money to juniors and some of it to the animal shelter. The 23-year-old, who was born in Moscow and shifted to Kazakhstan in 2018, defeated Ons Jabeur in the Wimbledon final.

47.title: Go and cause chaos, he's such a good player: Vaughan to Pant
47.article_body: Reacting to Rishabh Pant's form in limited-overs series against England, Michael Vaughan said ​​the India wicketkeeper-batter needs to be more aggressive. "He has got bat in his hand, go...cause chaos," he added. "He's such a good player, you just want him to have that freedom," he further said. He's scored 26, 1, 0 in limited-overs matches in England so far.

48.title: 1,000 firefighters, 10 water planes battle forest fires in France
48.article_body: A thousand firefighters supported by 10 water-showering planes battled two wildfires in southwest France on Friday as high temperatures and wind gusts complicated operations. The blazes forced the evacuation of 11,300 people in the Bordeaux region. In total, the fire has covered over 7,000 hectares (17,297 acres) of land, according to the regional emergency service.

49.title: Hamas rejects US President's expression of sympathy for Palestine
49.article_body: Gaza's militant group Hamas has rejected US President Joe Biden's expressions of sympathy for Palestine, calling the US "partner in the aggression on our people". Biden, who is currently on a Middle-East visit, pledged $300 million in aid to Palestinians and reiterated support for the two-state solution. Hamas also criticised Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas for meeting the US president.

50.title: Briton in detention in Ukraine's breakaway region passes away
50.article_body: Paul Urey, a British national who was detained in the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR), has passed away in detention, an official in Ukraine's breakaway region said on Friday. Urey had died of chronic illnesses and stress, the official added. He was accused of being a mercenary by the government of DPR.

51.title: No Cabinet in Maha amid flood situation will harm people: NCP chief
51.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday criticised the Maharashtra government and said that no Cabinet of ministers poses a threat to the people of the state amid a developing flood situation. "Two people are running Maharashtra government for [the] past 10 days," Pawar said. "The Cabinet hasn't been formed so far. There is no reason for delay," Pawar said.

52.title: Assam exports 600-kg lemons to UK
52.article_body: Assam exported around 600 kg of lemons to London on Friday as part of an export consignment. "Happy to share that the first consignment of Assam lemon for export to UK has been dispatched from Baksa," Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The lemons have been sent by the producer at the rate of ₹30 per kg, he added.

53.title: Kartik to make cameo in Luv Ranjan's Ranbir, Shraddha-starrer: Report
53.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan will be making a special appearance in filmmaker Luv Ranjan's upcoming romantic-comedy film which features Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor, reported Pinkvilla. Kartik and Luv have earlier worked together in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2', 'Akaash Vani' and 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'. Ranbir and Shraddha's untitled film will release in 2023.

54.title: It seemed like Pant had premeditated his shot in 2nd ODI: Ojha
54.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant's 0(5) in second ODI against England, Pragyan Ojha said it seemed like the India wicketkeeper-batter premeditated his shot in match. "He had to check his shot as it was a full-toss delivery...got out while trying to do that," he added. Ojha further said Pant should be given some cushion because of his ability to play match-winning innings.

55.title: Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius reveals it owes users $4.7 billion
55.article_body: Crypto lender Celsius, which has filed for bankruptcy, owes its users $4.7 billion, a filing with the Southern District of New York court revealed. In the filing, the firm also revealed it had a $1.19 billion deficit on its balance sheet. The company blamed the bankruptcy on inflation, the war in Ukraine and the collapse of several other crypto funds.

56.title: 3 teenagers drown while bathing in Jharkhand pond
56.article_body: Three teenagers, aged between 15 and 17, died in a pond in Jharkhand's Deoghar district on Friday, the local police said. The incident took place when the teenagers were bathing in the Nandan Pahar pond. Town police station in-charge MK Mandal said, "A team of NDRF fished out the bodies from the pond."

57.title: Biden becomes 1st US Prez to fly directly from Israel to S Arabia
57.article_body: Joe Biden has become the first US President to fly directly from Israel to Saudi Arabia. Biden met Saudi Arabia's King Salman and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman soon after arriving in the country. The visit comes as the US attempts to reset its relationship with a country that Biden once pledged to make a "pariah" on the global stage.

58.title: Crypto must come under auto info-exchange mechanism: FM Sitharaman to G20
58.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the group of 20 major economies to consider bringing cryptocurrencies under the ambit of the automatic exchange of information mechanism. The mechanism exists among countries to curb tax evasion. She said that investigations have shown tax evaders resorting to numerous layers of entities to mask their unaccounted wealth.

59.title: Finland replaces Russia as host of 6th leg of ISU Figure Skating Grand Prix
59.article_body: Finland has been named as the new hosts of the sixth leg of Grand Prix of Figure Skating Series after Russia was removed following its invasion of Ukraine, said International Skating Union (ISU). The November 25-27 event will be held in Espoo, Finland. The final will be held in Turin, Italy, from December 8-11.

60.title: Govt plans 'Right to Repair' framework to help consumers get products fixed independently
60.article_body: The government is working on a 'Right to Repair' framework to cut down restrictive practices introduced by some manufacturers so people can get goods such as consumer durables, phones and cars fixed on their own. Farming equipment, mobile phones/tablets, consumer durables and automobiles/automobile equipment are among the sectors identified by a government committee to implement the framework.

61.title: Bagwati in background: Abhay on 11 yrs of 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara'
61.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol shared a series of selfies on Instagram, writing in the caption, "It's not what you wear but how you wear it...#bagwatiinthebackgroundof1stpic #cheapbagwati #immacheapbagwati." One of the luxury bags in the film 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara', which has completed 11 years since its release, was called Bagwati. The Zoya Akhar directorial also features Hrithik Roshan and Farhan Akhtar.

62.title: BJP appoints Laxmikant Bajpai as chief whip of Rajya Sabha
62.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has appointed former Uttar Pradesh BJP President Laxmikant Bajpai as the party's chief whip in the Rajya Sabha. "I will discharge this responsibility given by the party leadership with full devotion," Bajpai said on Twitter. Bajpai has replaced Shiv Pratap Shukla who retired as a Member of Parliament from the Rajya Sabha.

63.title: Indian duo of Arjun-Kapila crashes out in Singapore Open men's quarters
63.article_body: Unseeded Indian duo of MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila crashed out of Singapore Open 2022 after losing to second seeds Mohammad Ahsan and Hendra Setiawan in the men's doubles quarter-final on Friday. The second seeded Indonesian pair defeated Arjun and Kapila 10-21, 21-18, 21-17 in 49 minutes. Earlier in the day, third seeded PV Sindhu entered the women's singles semi-final.

64.title: Will quit politics if any MLA who joined me loses polls: Maha CM
64.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has stated that he'll quit politics if any of the MLAs who joined him loses the next Assembly polls. "I'm confident that all these 50 MLAs will win the elections...If any of them loses, I'll resign from politics," he said. This comes after Shiv Sena MLAs, led by Shinde, rebelled against Uddhav Thackeray's leadership in Maharashtra.

65.title: Punjab HC judge recuses from hearing Bikram Majithia's bail plea
65.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court's Justice Anoop Chitkara on Friday recused himself from hearing the bail petition of Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia. A case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was registered against Majithia in December 2021. On July 4, Punjab and Haryana HC's Justice Augustine George Masih had recused himself in the matter.

66.title: Most road accidents occurred on straight roads in clear weather in 2020: Govt data
66.article_body: Around 65% (2.37 lakh) of all road accidents in India took place on straight roads in 2020, government data has shown. Such accidents killed over 85,000 people, the 'Road accidents in India- 2020' report released by the government this year, said. Over 72% of accidents and 67% of fatalities took place under sunny or clear weather in 2020, it added.

67.title: Celsius becomes 3rd major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in 3 weeks
67.article_body: Celsius has become the third major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in three weeks following the collapse of hedge fund Three Arrows Capital and broker Voyager Digital. The crypto lender said the decision was part of a financial restructuring that would "stabilise the business". The US-based platform had suspended customer withdrawals, swaps and transfers citing "extreme market conditions".

68.title: No concept of 'super CM' in present govt: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
68.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that there was no concept of "super CM" in the present Eknath Shinde-led government. "We have only one chief minister and that is Eknath Shinde. We are working under his leadership," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after some opposition leaders claimed that though Shinde is the CM, Fadnavis was taking the decisions.

69.title: Federal Bank's profit jumps 63% y-o-y to ₹600 crore, share price rises
69.article_body: The share price of private sector lender Federal Bank rose by 1.54% to ₹98.80 after it reported a 63.5% increase in net profit in the April-June quarter to ₹600.66 crore. The bank had reported a profit of ₹367 crore in the same period last year. Meanwhile, its net interest income rose by 13% to ₹1,604.5 crore.

70.title: Villagers yet to cremate body of Haryana farmer who died on July 8
70.article_body: The body of Dharampal, a farmer from Haryana's Hisar district who died in a clash with policemen on July 8, is yet to be cremated. Villagers refused to cremate him and protested against the arrest of four villagers in connection with the violence. Last week's clash erupted over the sale rights of fly ash generated from a nearby thermal plant.

71.title: India provides 3,000 tents as disaster relief material to Nepal
71.article_body: India on Friday handed over consignments of flood and disaster relief material to Nepal as part of its efforts to build a disaster-resilient country. The relief materials included 3,000 tents and ten motor inflatable boats, according to a statement from the Indian Embassy. Nepal's Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand thanked India for the timely delivery of the relief material.

72.title: Shreyas Talpade to be part of Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency': Report
72.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade will be a part of actress Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film 'Emergency' in which she will portray late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, as per reports. Kangana has produced the film under her production house Manikarnika Films and will also be directing it. She had earlier directed 2019 film 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi' which also stars Ankita Lokhande.

73.title: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh cr due to high capex: ICRA
73.article_body: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh crore as they've budgeted 36% higher capital expenditure during 2022-23, an ICRA report said. As many as 26 large states, except Assam, have spent ₹5 lakh crore in capex, a 34% rise from FY20, it added. In budget estimates, these states have pegged their revenue receipts at ₹35.8 lakh crore.

74.title: Mehbooba's sister identifies Yasin Malik as 1 of her kidnappers in 1989 case
74.article_body: Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti, has identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik and three others as her kidnappers, officials said. Rubaiya appeared before a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court on Friday in a case related to her abduction by Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) on December 8, 1989.

75.title: RBI likely to introduce new rules for fintech firms: Report
75.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is likely to announce new regulations for fintech companies, Moneycontrol reported. The rules will likely cover areas such as data sharing, privacy, compliance with KYC and anti-money laundering norms, the report said. This comes in the wake of complaints related to some fintechs charging usurious interest rates and other issues, the report added.

76.title: Govt will promote chess in schools and colleges: Odisha CM
76.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said his government will promote chess in schools and colleges. His comment comes after he handed the Chess Olympiad relay torch to Padmini Rout at a function in Bhubaneswar's Lokaseva Bhavan. It's a proud moment for India as it is hosting such an international event in the 75th year of Independence, Patnaik added.

77.title: Man kills 19-year-old daughter over love affair in UP's Firozabad
77.article_body: Police said that a man, identified as Manoj Rathore, allegedly killed his 19-year-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad by slitting her throat over her love affair with a man. The accused was taken into custody and the weapon he used in the crime was recovered, police said. The body has been sent for a postmortem, SP (Rural) Akhilesh Narayan said.

78.title: Lakhs of Iraqi cleric's followers gather in show of strength
78.article_body: Lakhs of Iraqi cleric Moqtada al-Sadr's followers gathered in the streets of Baghdad for a prayer on Friday in a show of strength to his political rivals. Sadr has vowed to disband powerful Iraqi militia groups loyal to Iran and to hold corrupt Iraqi politicians to account. Earlier, Sadr's attempt to form a government free of Iran-backed parties had failed.

79.title: RSS worker beaten up by police in UP's Bareilly, 10 booked
79.article_body: At least ten policemen were booked and one of them suspended after an RSS worker was allegedly beaten up following a road rage incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. According to RSS worker Aryanendra Kumar, he was beaten up by Sub-Inspector Ankit Kumar when he couldn't give space for the policeman's vehicle to pass. Ankit Kumar was suspended after the incident.

80.title: All 16 teams to feature in men's T20 World Cup 2022 confirmed, ICC share list
80.article_body: Netherlands and Zimbabwe have booked their place in ICC men's T20 World Cup 2022 after winning their semi-finals of Global Qualifier B. With this, all 16 teams to qualify for the tournament have been confirmed. Ireland and UAE qualified from Global Qualifier A, while top 11 teams from the men's T20 World Cup 2021 and hosts Australia had already qualified.

81.title: Man beheads wife, walks 12 km with her head to Odisha police station
81.article_body: A 55-year-old man allegedly beheaded his wife after suspecting her of having illicit relations in Odisha's Dhenkanal. As per reports, Nakaphodi Majhi walked 12 km to Gondia Police Station with his wife's severed head to surrender on Friday. Locals reportedly captured him while he was en route to the station. Police have recovered the blood-stained weapon used in the crime.

82.title: Heroin worth ₹3 crore seized from fuel tank of car in Assam; 1 held
82.article_body: Assam Police on Friday seized around 470 grams of heroin worth around ₹3-4 crore and has arrested a drug peddler in this connection in Karimganj district. The contraband was seized from a fuel tank of a car. According to Karimganj SP, an operation was launched after they received information that the consignment of drugs was coming from Mizoram.

83.title: I just wanted to act: Manish on being a successful actor after 20 years
83.article_body: Speaking about being successful after 20 years of his career, actor Manish Chaudhari said he never thought about success in a commercial sense. "I just wanted to act. OTT platforms gave an actor opportunities to do their job sincerely and bring their audience to them," he added. Manish said he looks at his characters and tries to understand their conflicts.

84.title: I wish I'd get a role like 'Padmaavat', 'Bajirao Mastani': Sai Pallavi
84.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi has stated that she has seen a few films which made her wish to get a role like that. "I have seen 'Padmaavat' and 'Bajirao Mastani' and sometimes you will think so," the actress added. She further said that she felt satisfied doing 'Shyam Singha Roy' in which she played someone from a different time.

85.title: Pune activists allege discrepancies in poll papers of Maha CM
85.article_body: Two Pune-based activists have moved a court to register an offence against Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, alleging discrepancies in his affidavits filed for legislative assembly polls in the past. The discrepancies pertain to the declaration of movable and immovable assets of Shinde, according to the activists. Shinde is a four-time legislator from Kopri Pachpakhadi constituency.

86.title: ED seizes cash worth ₹11.88 crore from Jharkhand CM's aide, others
86.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹11.88 crore from 37 bank accounts belonging to Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, among others, in a money laundering case. According to the agency, the cash came from illegal mining in multiple places, including Sahibganj, which is CM Soren's constituency.

87.title: CMs of Assam & Arunachal Pradesh sign pact to resolve border dispute
87.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and his Arunachal Pradesh counterpart Pema Khandu on Friday signed an agreement to resolve the border dispute between the two states. "We've decided to restrict the 'disputed villages' to 86 instead of 123," Sarma said. "Based on our present boundary, we'll try to resolve the rest by 15 Sept 2022," he added.

88.title: 9 motorcycles destroyed in fire in Pune residential parking
88.article_body: Nine motorcycles were destroyed in a fire at a residential complex's parking lot in Pune's Chandannagar locality on Thursday. No casualties were reported. "The exact reason for the fire is not known. However, prima facie...the fire broke out in the electricity meters installed in the parking lot," fire duty officer Tandel Sunil Devkar said.

89.title: How has Kohli performed in int'l cricket since his last hundred 965 days ago?
89.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli has gone 965 days without scoring an international hundred. Since his last international hundred which came on November 23, 2019, Kohli has scored 2,537 runs in 78 international innings across formats at an average of 35.73. He has hit 24 fifties, with highest score of 94*(50) that came in a T20I on December 6, 2019.

90.title: Roger Federer calls me 'Quack': World no. 74 James Duckworth
90.article_body: World number 74 James Duckworth has revealed that 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer calls him "Quack". He added, "We were playing at the Australian Open [2014] one year and it often happens as well, the quacking in the crowd and he thought that it was pretty funny. So that's what he calls me." Notably, Duckworth is known as "Ducks".

91.title: Chinese Prez Xi Jinping visits Xinjiang for 1st time since 2014
91.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Xinjiang region this week for the first time since 2014. Xi called Xinjiang a "core area and hub" in Belt and Road Initiative that seeks to better connect China's economy to Central Asia and Eastern Europe, state media reported. Notably, Xi's visit comes amid accusations by critics of a crackdown on Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

92.title: BJP shares alleged pic of ex-VP Ansari at event with Pak journalist, Ansari denies
92.article_body: Former Vice-President Hamid Ansari has reiterated that he never knew Pakistani journalist Nusrat Mirza after BJP shared a picture purportedly showing him sharing a stage with Mirza. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia alleged that the picture showed Ansari and Mirza at an Indian conference in 2009. Mirza, who's claimed to have spied for ISI, alleged Ansari shared "classified" information with him.

93.title: RSS means love for nation: Giriraj Singh on Patna SSP's PFI remark
93.article_body: After Patna SSP Manavjit Singh drew parallels between Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), Union Minister Giriraj Singh tweeted, "RSS means love for the nation, RSS means welfare of the nation, RSS means service to the nation...RSS means humanity and harmony." He added, "Every sensible person…understands this, except a few who've an agenda."

94.title: Every innings is going to pile up pressure: Jaffer after Kohli's 16 at Lord's
94.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's poor form, Wasim Jaffer stated that every innings is going to pile up pressure on him and probably put doubts in him. "People keep reminding him. I'm sure it adds up...if he had played those T20Is [against West Indies], he would've been in touch," he added. Kohli scored 16(25) against England in second ODI at Lord's.

95.title: Govt shares symptoms of monkeypox as India reports its first case
95.article_body: After India's first monkeypox case was reported in Kerala on Thursday, government shared a list of monkeypox symptoms. Listing common symptoms, which include fever and skin rashes, government said, "Individuals who have history of exposure to a suspected/confirmed case of monkeypox in the last 21 days should monitor their health and should seek medical attention if they exhibit these symptoms."

96.title: Adani Ports to buy Israel's Haifa Port with local firm for $1.18 bn
96.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone have won a bid to acquire Israel's Haifa Port with local firm Gadot Group for $1.18 billion, Israel announced on Thursday. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone will have a 70% stake and Gadot will hold the remaining 30%. Adani Ports said the acquisition will boost trade lanes with its Indian ports.

97.title: He needs support: Babar Azam on 'This too shall pass' tweet for Virat Kohli
97.article_body: Talking about his 'This too shall pass, stay strong' tweet for Virat Kohli, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "In...times [when you are out of form], you need support." "I just tweeted thinking...it'll give just some support. He's one of the best," Babar said. He added, "He's playing a lot of cricket...He knows how to come out of these situations."

98.title: Blockchain firm 5ire raises $100 mn, becomes India's 105th unicorn
98.article_body: Blockchain platform 5ire has raised $100 million at a valuation of $1.5 billion in a Series A funding round from the UK-based conglomerate SRAM & MRAM Group. This funding has made the company India's 105th unicorn and the 20th one this year. The funds will be used for business expansion and extending 5ire's footprint across Asia, North America and Europe.

99.title: UK issues its first ever red 'Extreme Heat' warning
99.article_body: Britain's weather forecaster issued its first ever red 'Extreme Heat' warning for parts of England on Monday and Tuesday when temperatures are predicted to reach record highs. The highest ever recorded temperature in Britain was 38.7°C recorded in Cambridge University Botanic Garden in July 2019. Met Office said it was now forecasting temperatures of 40°C for first time in Britain.

100.title: Wait for CBSE results before starting admissions: UGC to universities
100.article_body: The Chairman of University Grants Commission (UGC), Mamidala Jagadesh Kumar, has stated that the commission has told all higher educational institutions to wait for the CBSE Class 12 results before commencing their admission processes for undergraduate courses. Kumar said this will avoid the possibility of CBSE students being deprived of admission due to seats filled by other boards' students.

101.title: India's long-term growth prospects embedded in public capex programmes: FM
101.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's long-term growth prospects are embedded in public capital expenditure programmes. Speaking at the third G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting in Bali, she added that evidence-based policy making is vital for resilient economic systems. She had raised capital expenditure by 35.4% for 2022-23 to ₹7.5 lakh crore to boost demand.

102.title: Sri Lankan court bars ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa from leaving country
102.article_body: Sri Lanka's Supreme Court on Friday barred former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa from leaving the country without permission until July 28, anti-corruption group Transparency International Sri Lanka said. Similar restrictions were also imposed on three former officials, it added. This comes after ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country amid protests.

103.title: Hrithik and I are closer in our method, Ranbir is very talkative: Vaani
103.article_body: Speaking about her co-stars, actress Vaani Kapoor said that she is the closest to actor Hrithik Roshan in their methods of acting. "He also doesn't talk much...We both just [sit] next to each other [quietly] thinking about the scene," she said. The actress further said that her 'Shamshera' co-star Ranbir Kapoor can be talkative and still transition suddenly.

104.title: Sense of national pride inspires us to sacrifice: Rajnath Singh
104.article_body: After launching INS Dunagiri, a Project 17A frigate into the Hooghly river in Kolkata on Friday, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that a sense of national pride inspires us to sacrifice. "The feeling of national pride is pretty strong," he said. The ship will prove to be a very big asset to the country, Singh added.

105.title: RBI's new settlement system unlikely to be used widely: Capital Economics
105.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) new system for settling international trade in rupees is unlikely to be used widely, Capital Economics said. Assistant Economist Adam Hoyes said that most global trade is settled in dollars because settling it in alternative currencies is usually more expensive. The depth and liquidity of dollar markets make dollars a cheaper option, he added.

106.title: Woman willingly living with man can't file rape case if relationship turns sour: SC
106.article_body: A woman in a relationship with a man and willingly living with him cannot file a rape case if the relationship turns sour, Supreme Court observed. It granted anticipatory bail to a man accused of rape by a woman with whom he had a four-year relationship. Rajasthan HC earlier denied him pre-arrest bail saying he'd promised to marry the woman.

107.title: My dad likes my films when I'm not remaking his films: Sara Ali Khan
107.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan recently appeared on celebrity talk show 'Koffee With Karan' and was asked whether her father actor Saif Ali Khan likes her films. The actress answered, "My dad likes my films when I'm not remaking his films." Sara worked in 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal' which was a spiritual sequel of Saif's 2009 film 'Love Aaj Kal'.

108.title: ICMR trains 15 research centres for monkeypox detection in India
108.article_body: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Friday announced that its National Institute of Virology has trained 15 virus research centres across the country to detect monkeypox virus. The ICMR said these research centres are geographically well-distributed and strategically located. This comes a day after a man tested positive for monkeypox in Kerala after returning from the UAE.

109.title: Chinese economy shrinks by 2.6% in Apr-Jun quarter
109.article_body: The Chinese economy shrank by 2.6% in the April-June quarter this year, as experts forecasted Beijing missing its 5.5% growth target for this financial year. This is China's weakest quarterly growth since the beginning of the pandemic. The April-June quarter was marked by the lockdowns in Shanghai and other cities as China fought to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

110.title: Attacks on Shiv Sena workers will not be tolerated: Uddhav Thackeray
110.article_body: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that attacks on party workers would not be tolerated. "If police cannot bring the culprits to book, Sena workers will do it," Uddhav Thackeray said. His comment comes after he met Shiv Sena worker Baban Gaonkar who was attacked by unidentified persons on Thursday night.

111.title: It is his life and his decision: Lalit Modi's son Ruchir on his father dating Sushmita
111.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi's 28-year-old son Ruchir Modi reacted to news of his father dating actress Sushmita Sen. Ruchir said, "It's his life and his decision." Lalit took to social media on Thursday to make his relationship with Sushmita public. Earlier today, Sushmita shared a post on Instagram, writing, "I'm in a happy place!!!...Not married...no rings...Unconditionally surrounded by love!!"

112.title: Pak PM's son declared proclaimed offender in money laundering case
112.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's younger son Suleman Shehbaz was declared a proclaimed offender in a money laundering case by a special court in Lahore on Friday. This comes after Suleman failed to appear in court for a hearing despite being summoned. Notably, the court had granted PM Sharif, who is also an accused, a one-time exemption from attending the hearing.

113.title: Bombay HC grants bail to alleged Naxal in Gadchiroli blast case
113.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Friday granted bail to alleged Naxal operative Sathyanarayana Rani who is accused in the Gadchiroli blast case. In his plea, 72-year-old Sathyanarayana said he spent nearly three years in jail despite there being no evidence against him. On May 1, 2019, a blast in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, killed 15 security personnel of the Quick Response Team.

114.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, hashish oil worth ₹15 lakh seized
114.article_body: The Special Operations Team (SOT) of the Hyderabad Police arrested two inter-state drug peddlers and seized four litres of hashish oil worth ₹15 lakh from them, Rachakonda Police tweeted. The accused have been identified as 24-year-old K Shiva, a student, and 25-year-old P Nuka Raju, a cook from Visakhapatnam. The two associates of the accused are absconding.

115.title: Strange 'heartbeat' signal from distant galaxy detected by scientists
115.article_body: Scientists have detected a strange and persistent radio signal from a far-off galaxy that appears to be flashing with regularity. The signal could emanate from either a radio pulsar or a magnetar, both of which are types of neutron stars. "There were periodic peaks that were remarkably precise, emitting every fraction of a second...like a heartbeat," said MIT's Daniele Michilli.

116.title: There's misgovernance, corruption in Mumbai civic body: Deora
116.article_body: Congress leader Milind Deora said there is "misgovernance and corruption" in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation and that the municipality's recent delimitation was done to benefit the Shiv Sena. The BMC elections are scheduled for later this year and Deora said the Congress should be ready to take on Shiv Sena. Last year, the number of BMC seats increased to 236.

117.title: 5 dead, 9 hurt as godown wall collapses in Delhi; PM says, 'anguished'
117.article_body: Five people died and nine others sustained injuries after a wall collapsed at an under-construction godown in Delhi's Alipur on Friday, police said. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital and two of them are said to be in critical condition. "Anguished by the mishap...My thoughts are with those who've lost their loved ones," PM Narendra Modi said.

118.title: Mumbai Metro-3 car depot site home to 5 leopards: Study
118.article_body: A camera trapping study at the Mumbai Metro Line-3 car depot site in Aarey Milk Colony has found the presence of five leopards in it. Jungle cats, mongooses and monitor lizards were also found. The depot project was stalled after the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi state government declared the area as forest land and moved the project out of there.

119.title: He needs bit more willpower to emerge from this phase: Saba on Kohli's form
119.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's dismissal in second ODI against England, Saba Karim said the India batter needs a little more concentration and stronger willpower to emerge from the ongoing phase of low scores. Kohli scored 16 runs off 25 deliveries at Lord's on Thursday. The ex-India captain scored his last international century in November 2019.

120.title: 65-year-old man shot dead inside mosque in UP
120.article_body: A 65-year-old man was shot dead inside a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Khurja Nagar on Friday, police said. Idris, a resident of Sheikhpen locality, was attacked while he and his sons were walking on a road. Thereafter, Idris reportedly rushed inside the mosque. His family said the crime has been committed by their acquaintances who belong to the same community.

121.title: 1 soldier killed, 3 injured in alleged fratricide incident in J&K
121.article_body: A soldier was killed and three others were injured in an alleged fratricide incident inside an Army camp in the Surankote area of Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Friday, officials have confirmed. The injured persons were airlifted to an Army hospital in Udhampur and one of them is said to be in a critical condition, as per reports.

122.title: Kyrgios is still disappointed to come so close but not win Wimbledon: Hewitt
122.article_body: Talking about Nick Kyrgios, who reached his maiden Grand slam final at Wimbledon last week, ex-world number one Lleyton Hewitt said deep down the fellow Australian is still disappointed to come so close but not win Wimbledon title. He added that Kyrgios should be proud of his whole grass-court season. Novak Djokovic beat Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in final.

123.title: Men offer Namaz in Lulu's biggest Indian mall in UP, FIR filed as video goes viral
123.article_body: An FIR was filed against unidentified men who were seen, in a viral video, offering Namaz at Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall in UP's Lucknow. The FIR was filed on a complaint registered by the mall authorities. "Lulu Mall respects all religions," said the mall's General Manager Sameer Verma, adding, "Any kind of religious work or prayer isn't permitted here."

124.title: You work hard to get popular, when you get popular you hide: Ranbir
124.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that any actor who says they don't enjoy the attention they get will be lying. "You work so hard to get popular, then when you get popular you go and hide. It's ironic," he added. Ranbir further said he wishes he could hold on to some personal life and keep it private but it's okay.

125.title: Gurugram Police grants interfaith couple protection over threat to life
125.article_body: An interfaith couple was granted protection by Gurugram Police after the woman's family allegedly threatened to kill them, the police said on Thursday. The Muslim woman had left her home on July 8 to live with her Hindu partner, the police added. The couple was granted police protection after the woman's family assaulted them.

126.title: Rare whirlwind destroys farmland in Madhya Pradesh, video surfaces
126.article_body: A video of a rare whirlwind destroying a farmland in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain has surfaced online. In the video, locals can be seen witnessing the whirlwind, with some taking pictures and videos. "Nature can ruin everything in a second," a social media user commented on the video. "It looks scary," wrote another.

127.title: Development not possible without establishing peace: J&K LG
127.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha on Friday said development was not possible without establishing peace, adding that some people were trying to provoke security forces and the administration to fuel unrest. The security forces are working hard round-the-clock for the safety and security of the common people, Sinha said. There's need to create awareness in the society, Sinha added.

128.title: India-made ring with 24,679 diamonds sets Guinness World Record, pics surface
128.article_body: A mushroom-shaped diamond ring made by Kerala's SWA Diamonds set a new Guinness World Record in May 2022 for the 'most diamonds set in one ring'. The ring named 'The Touch of Ami' has a total of 24,679 diamonds and was manufactured in Malappuram. It has been designed by Rijisha TV, who's a post-graduate from the National Institute of Design.

129.title: PM Narendra Modi calls TN CM Stalin to enquire about his health
129.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday called Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin to enquire about his health after the latter tested positive for COVID-19 and was admitted to Kauvery Hospital in Chennai. During the call, MK Stalin thanked PM Modi and invited him to the inauguration of the 44th International Chess Olympiad which will commence on July 28 in Mamallapuram.

130.title: China sees most COVID-19 cases since May
130.article_body: China on Thursday reported 432 COVID-19 cases, up from 292 on Wednesday and the most since May 25. Over a third or 165 cases were found in Guangxi province. As of Monday, some three crore people across China were under some form of movement restrictions to quell COVID-19 transmission. China has reported more than 51 lakh virus cases so far.

131.title: Can jobless youth use unparliamentary words like 'misled, cheated'?: Rahul
131.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday criticised PM Narendra Modi over the issue of joblessness. While sharing a graph showing percentage of unemployment in the last five years, Rahul asked, "Where are the two crore jobs/year, Prime Minister?" "Misled. Betrayed. Cheated. Prime Minister, can India's unemployed youth use these 'unparliamentary' words for your lies?" he further stated.

132.title: Road made with 3,000 kgs plastic waste to ease traffic in B'luru
132.article_body: A newly-constructed road, entirely made with 3,000 kilograms of plastic waste, has been opened to public in Bengaluru. The road will connect Outer Ring Road and RMZ Ecoworld in Bellandur. The new stretch, first of its kind in the city, is expected to decongest heavy traffic during peak hours and reduce the commute time by 30 minutes.

133.title: I want to play negative characters like Thanos or Joker: Sanjay Dutt
133.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt stated that he wants to play negative characters like Thanos from the 'Avengers' films or Joker from 'The Dark Knight'. "I don't like to play all-negative characters. There has to be something about that character so you say yes," he added. The actor said his character Kancha from 2012 film 'Agneepath' was menacing but read Bhagavad Gita.

134.title: Pacer Navdeep Saini joins Kent to play in English domestic cricket
134.article_body: Indian pacer Navdeep Saini has joined the Kent County Cricket Club to play in the ongoing English domestic cricket season. The 29-year-old bowler has signed a contract to play a total of eight games, subject to his visa clearance. "In a year when it's been difficult to take wickets, we're excited to...add [Saini]," said Paul Downton, the Director of Kent.

135.title: MHA website ranks 1st among central ministry services portals: Govt
135.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has ranked first and its Digital Police portal second in a service delivery assessment of websites of central government ministries. The National e-Governance Service Delivery Assessment is a periodic assessment intended to improve the effectiveness of the states and Union Territories and the central government in the delivery of their online services to the public.

136.title: He'd keep telling Alia and me 'Go and get married': Ranbir on father Rishi
136.article_body: Discussing his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "We spent a lot of time with him in New York in the hospital, Alia Bhatt and [me], and he kept telling us, 'Why're you...wasting...time?'" "Go and get married...Why're you sitting in the hospital," added Ranbir, sharing his father's words. "He always used to joke around," stated Ranbir.

137.title: Became poster boy of a cheater, people haven't heard my perspective: Ranbir
137.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said in an interview that he was made the "poster boy of a casanova, of a cheater". "People have heard somebody's perspective, somebody's point of view and they haven't heard mine," he said. Ranbir, however, added that it doesn't bother him if "somebody bi**es" about him or if anyone says anything bad about him.

138.title: Tara to make singing debut in 'Ek Villain...', song to release on July 16
138.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria is all set to make her singing debut with a song titled 'Shaamat' for her upcoming film 'Ek Villain Returns'. She took to Instagram on Friday to share the news with her fans and followers and added that the song will be released on July 16. The lyrics for the song have been written by Prince Dubey.

139.title: ODI format suits Dhawan the best; glad selectors showed faith: Manjrekar
139.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said that the one-day cricket format suits a lot to India's opening batter Shikhar Dhawan. "This is a format [ODI] that suits him best...where he's been excellent. And I'm so glad that selectors have shown faith in him," Manjrekar said. "If you look at his [ODI] performances, it's always been the best," he added.

140.title: Patna SSP likens Islamic extremist outfit PFI to RSS, sparks row
140.article_body: Patna's SSP Manavjit Singh Dhillon compared the training of Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) with the training at Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) shakhas on Thursday. "[PFI's] modus operandi was to act like an RSS shakha…They'd call [youths] for physical training but also…radicalise them," he said. Bihar BJP spokesperson condemned his remarks and called for his resignation.

141.title: KK's family calls his death 'worst pain', says 'He was a different species'
141.article_body: Late singer KK's family has shared a note on his official Instagram handle, saying that his death is the worst pain they have experienced. "He was a different species of human, not only...as a performer but...as a father/husband," the note read. It added that KK "got the chance to be doing what he loved almost until his last moments".

142.title: Will target Russian gold in next sanctions package: EU
142.article_body: The European Union will target Russian gold exports in its next sanctions package and seek to "close exit routes" for those bypassing its earlier packages, Maros Sefcovic, deputy head of European Commission, said. So far, EU has approved six sanction packages against Russia over Ukraine war. The last package, passed in June, implemented a ban on most Russian oil imports.

143.title: Delhi traffic signals to get signages indicating speed limits, timer displays
143.article_body: Traffic signals in Delhi will soon get electronic signages indicating speed limits, reports said. Timer displays will also be added to signals. Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has directed officials to install these devices at all traffic intersections across city. Delhi Police have also been asked to ensure least manual interventions for enforcement and challans in the national capital.

144.title: Under-construction godown wall collapses in Delhi; 5 dead & 2 critical
144.article_body: Five people have died and nine have been injured after a wall of an under-construction godown collapsed in Delhi's Alipur on Friday. The injured people, two of whom are in critical condition, have been hospitalised. Delhi Police fear that some people may still be trapped under the debris. The incident reportedly took place at Bakoli village near Chauhan Dharam Kanta.

145.title: Mumbai reports 3 swine flu cases in 10 days; toll reaches 7
145.article_body: In the first 10 days of July, three swine flu (H1N1) cases were recorded in Mumbai. The total number of H1N1 cases reported in the city so far has reached seven. "In the last two months, we have seen a 6-10% rise in Influenza A infections as compared to the previous year," a doctor at the SRV Mamata Hospital said.

146.title: Chhattisgarh govt to buy cattle urine from farmers at ₹4 per litre
146.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government is planning to procure cattle urine from farmers and cattle owners at ₹4 per litre. A pilot project of the scheme will be launched in the upcoming weeks, officials informed on Friday. According to Pradeep Sharma, adviser to CM Bhupesh Baghel, the urine will be procured through Gram Gauthan Samiti and payments will be made fortnightly.

147.title: Hundreds more evacuated as wildfires spread in France
147.article_body: Hundreds more people were evacuated from their homes as wildfires continued to spread in southwestern France, authorities said on Friday. Since Tuesday, more than 1,000 firefighters supported by nine water-bomber planes have been battling to contain two wildfires fanned by scorching heat, tinder-box conditions and strong winds. The wildfires have burnt around 7,300 hectares of land so far.

148.title: Which are the top 10 dental colleges in India as per govt's rankings released today?
148.article_body: As per the latest rankings released by the government today, Saveetha Institute of Medical and Technical Sciences in Chennai has been ranked the best dental college. It is followed by Manipal's Manipal College of Dental Sciences and Pune's Dr DY Patil Vidyapeeth. Maulana Azad Institute of Dental Sciences in Delhi has been ranked fourth.

149.title: Sushmita shares 1st post after Lalit Modi says they are dating, says 'clarified enough'
149.article_body: Sushmita Sen has shared her first post after Lalit Modi revealed that they are dating. Sharing a picture with her daughters, Sushmita wrote, I am in a happy place. Not married...no rings...Enough clarification given...now back to life & work," she wrote. "Thank you for sharing in my happiness always, and for those who don't...it's #NOYB anyway," she added.

150.title: MP man threatened for supporting Nupur Sharma; 5 arrested
150.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore was allegedly threatened for supporting former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma who was suspended after her remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The police booked and arrested five people after receiving a complaint in the matter. "Nobody will be allowed to disrupt peace in the state," said MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra.

151.title: Most of the current actors have forgotten what heroism is: Sanjay Dutt
151.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said most of the current actors have forgotten what heroism is and what commercial cinema is all about. "There's nothing to [be] scared of in working opposite each other...Don't get insecure," added Sanjay. Discussing the characters he would like to play, Sanjay stated 'Thanos' from 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Joker' from the 'Batman' franchise would be fun.

152.title: Godavari water rises to 19 lakh cusecs in Andhra, crosses 3rd danger level
152.article_body: Hundreds of villages are facing a flood situation as the flood water in the Godavari river has risen to over 19 lakh cusecs in Andhra Pradesh, reports said. Reports added the flood water has crossed third danger signal at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage at Dowaleswaram near Rajamahendravaram. An official said water could touch 22-23 lakh cusecs in few hours.

153.title: 3 GHMC employees held for creating fake fingerprints in Hyderabad
153.article_body: The Central Zone Task Force on Thursday arrested three Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) employees for their alleged involvement in creating fake fingerprints. The accused allegedly created fake fingerprints to mark the attendance of sanitation workers through the biometric machine. Police also seized 43 fake fingerprints and thumb impressions along with three biometric machines.

154.title: Hotels told to remove word 'beef' from signs in Arunachal's Naharlagun
154.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh's Naharlagun sub-division administration has issued an order directing hotels and restaurants in the area to remove the word 'beef' from their signboards by July 18 to maintain the "spirit of secularism". As per the order, a ₹2,000 fine will be imposed and a process to cancel trade license will be started if an establishment fails to do so.

155.title: Thane man rapes, strangles 10-year-old daughter; arrested
155.article_body: Police on Friday said that a 10-year-old girl was allegedly raped and strangled to death by her father in Thane's Bhiwandi. The 34-year-old accused was arrested for the crime that took place on Thursday, police said, adding the accused strangled the girl to death with a piece of cloth. A case has been registered under relevant sections of POCSO Act.

156.title: Goa man killed for objecting to people trying to gatecrash his b'day
156.article_body: A man was allegedly beaten to death on his 22nd birthday by some people after he objected to their attempt to gatecrash his party in a slum area near Margao in Goa, police said. Five people have been arrested over the incident. The accused assaulted the deceased with a log of wood and a ring-like object, SP Abhishek Dhania said.

157.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.5 lakh by fraudster posing as her boss
157.article_body: A 53-year-old woman working as secretary in a Mumbai hotel was cheated of ₹2.5 lakh by a person impersonating the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of the hotel. The accused asked the woman to purchase 25 e-gift cards of ₹10,000 each from an e-commerce company, police said. The next afternoon, when she met the COO, she learnt she had been cheated.

158.title: Photo of couple kissing amid anti-government protests in Sri Lanka goes viral
158.article_body: A photo of a couple kissing amid anti-government protests in Sri Lanka, with scores of protestors standing in the backdrop, has gone viral. The man and the woman are seen kissing during the protest at the Prime Minister's office in Colombo. Many Twitter users reacted to the photo, with one comment reading, "Love in the middle of a firefight."

159.title: Musk accused lawyers of causing trouble by seeking deal's financing info: Twitter
159.article_body: In its lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has shared a purported image of a text message that Musk sent to CEO Parag Agrawal before terminating the deal. Musk's message read, "Your lawyers are using these conversations to cause trouble….That needs to stop." Musk's message was in response to the company seeking information regarding the deal's financing.

160.title: Playing quintessential B'wood hero is hardest, easy to do good film: Ranbir
160.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said playing a quintessential Bollywood hero is the hardest, adding that acting in a good film is "easy". "There's a lot that goes [into it]...It takes the right amount of conviction...[and also]...heaps of luck," stated Ranbir. Discussing his film 'Shamshera', Ranbir said he may not have had the confidence to do such a film 10 years ago.

161.title: Saudi Arabia will open its airspace to Israeli airlines: Israel's PM
161.article_body: Amid US President Joe Biden's visit to Middle East, Israel's PM Yair Lapid announced that Saudi Arabia will open airspace to Israeli airlines. The development comes "after a long road of intense and covert diplomacy with Saudi Arabia and the US", Lapid said. Biden, who welcomed the decision, said that it was an important step towards stability in the region.

162.title: Almost all states prepared draft rules on labour codes: Bhupender Yadav
162.article_body: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav has said that almost all Indian states have prepared draft rules on the four labour codes. "Almost all states have finalised draft rules...We will implement the codes [in one go] at an appropriate time," Yadav said. He added that there are a few Northeastern states, including Meghalaya, which have not completed the process yet.

163.title: Netflix ties up with Microsoft for cheaper ad-supported subscription
163.article_body: Netflix has announced a partnership with Microsoft for its ad-supported subscription plan. The technology giant will serve as a "global advertising technology and sales partner" for the streaming service. Netflix had announced in April that it was looking to offer a cheaper ad-supported option to its customers after nearly 200,000 subscribers left the platform in this year's first quarter.

164.title: B'luru parks to stay open for 2.5 hrs more, maintenance breaks shortened
164.article_body: Bengaluru parks will now stay open for 2.5 hours more, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has said. The maintenance breaks have been shortened to be held between 10:00 am to 1:30 pm from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm. Chief Commissioner of BBMP took to Twitter to share the circular by the civic body.

165.title: Don't stop vehicles unless visible traffic violation: Goa IGP to officials
165.article_body: Goa Inspector General of Police (IGP) Omvir Singh on Friday ordered officials to not stop vehicles unless there is a visible traffic violation. "It has been reported that traffic police are stopping the vehicles needlessly...for the want of checking of requisite documents of the vehicles," he said. "Public is alleging undue harassment and has alleged inconvenience," Singh further said.

166.title: 'Chup' is a commercial thriller, will release in theatres: Director
166.article_body: Director R Balki has said his upcoming film 'Chup', starring Sunny Deol and Dulquer Salmaan, is a "commercial thriller", which will be released in theatres in the next two months. "[It's] in a world never done before. The thought is very relevant today," Balki added. Pooja Bhatt and Shreya Dhanwanthary are also part of the film.

167.title: John, 'Special OPS' director Shivam team up for a geopolitical thriller
167.article_body: Shivam Nair, who helmed 'Special OPS' and 'Naam Shabana', has said he is working on a geopolitical thriller which will feature John Abraham in the lead role. "I have been working on this...A lot of hard work and research has gone into the creation of the story structure and this script," he said. John is currently working on action-thriller 'Tehran'.

168.title: World no. 24 Saina loses to world no. 30 Ohori in Singapore Open quarters
168.article_body: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal lost to world number 30 Aya Ohori of Japan 13-21, 21-15, 20-22 in women's singles quarter-final at Singapore Open 2022 on Friday. The world number 24 lost the match in one hour three minutes. In men's singles quarter-final, India's HS Prannoy was beaten by world number 43 Kodai Naraoka. The Japanese defeated Prannoy 12-21, 21-14, 21-18.

169.title: 2 journalists shot at in UP's Sonbhadra, FIR filed
169.article_body: Two journalists working with Hindi newspapers were shot at by bike-borne suspects in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra district on Thursday, said police. They were rushed to the BHU Medical College and were said to be out of danger. The incident occurred when the journalists were having tea at a restaurant in Kaliyari market, said police. An FIR has been registered.

170.title: Attach bank accounts of person in Shree Ramkrishna Electro case: SEBI
170.article_body: SEBI has ordered the attachment of bank accounts along with share and mutual fund holdings of an individual to recover about ₹18 crore in the Shree Ramkrishna Electro Controls case. The recovery proceedings have been ordered against Chandrakant Bhargav Gole to recover ₹5.74 crore collected by the company along with ₹12.53 crore at 15% interest per annum.

171.title: Kerala issues alert as monkeypox patient had co-passengers from 5 districts
171.article_body: Kerala on Friday issued an alert to all 14 districts, a day after India confirmed its first monkeypox case in the state. "People from Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha and Kottayam, travelled along with the infected person from the UAE," state Health Minister Veena George said. Eleven of the patient's contacts have been put under the high-risk category, she added.

172.title: I lived in a small room, there were 7-8 of us: Actor Anil Kapoor
172.article_body: Recalling the time when his family was struggling financially, Anil Kapoor said, "[We lived] in a small room where there were...seven-eight of us." "My mother and father [earlier lived in]...an outhouse," added Anil. Anil stated his life's turning point was when he was informed that his father had heart issues, adding he started working as a spot boy at 17.

173.title: Pune civic body to provide free COVID-19 booster doses at 68 centres
173.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to provide free COVID-19 booster doses at 68 vaccination centres run by the health department. These centres will have both Covaxin and Covishield doses for beneficiaries, officials said. "In PMC limits, there are over three million beneficiaries from 18 and above age group who are yet to receive the booster dose," the immunisation officer said.

174.title: Fadnavis meets Raj, wishes him a speedy recovery; pics surface
174.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis met MNS chief Raj Thackeray at his residence in Mumbai today. He also shared pictures and a video of the meeting on Twitter.
