Fadnavis said that he inquired about Raj's health and wished him a speedy recovery. Raj had undergone hip replacement surgery last month. This is Fadnavis' first visit to Raj since the surgery.

175.title: Siddaramaiah demands narco test on PSI scam accused ADGP Paul
175.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday demanded a narco test on ADGP Amrit Paul who was arrested in connection with the 2021 Karnataka police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "If Amrit Paul...is subjected to...narco test, then it will be clear who all...politicians are involved," Siddaramaiah said. "There should be no attempt to cover up this case," he added.

176.title: Gurugram civic body launches single-use plastic awareness campaign
176.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has launched a campaign to make residents aware about the use of single-use plastic (SUP) items that were banned in the city from July 1. "MCG teams will visit malls, schools...to educate all about the harmful effects of the SUP items," Gurugram mayor Madhu Azad said while launching the campaign at a private school.

177.title: Rare giant deep sea creature caught in Chile, pics go viral
177.article_body: A rare giant sea creature was caught by a group of fishermen in Chile's Arica. It was identified as 16-foot oarfish. Pictures and videos showing a crane hoisting the fish have surfaced on social media. The fish is believed to reside in deep water and surface only during the breeding season or when unwell or dying.

178.title: We'll try our best to win men's hockey gold at CWG 2022: Harmanpreet
178.article_body: Ahead of upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022, Indian men's hockey team vice-captain Harmanpreet Singh said his side will try their best to win a gold medal in Birmingham. "Our team has been performing well. We played well in FIH Hockey Pro League as well," he added. India will face Ghana in their first match of Pool B on July 31.

179.title: Biden must've been drowsy when he threatened Iran: Iranian military
179.article_body: Iranian military has warned the US and Israel against threatening Iran with force. This comes after US President Joe Biden said he's prepared to use force to stop Iran from getting nuclear arms. "Biden must've been drowsy when he threatened Iran," Iranian military spokesman, Brigadier General Abolfazl Shekarchi, said, adding, "Watch your soldiers' pants, they might get wet in...Persian Gulf!"

180.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi, accused of flashing his genitals at 2 children, gets bail
180.article_body: Kerala High Court on Friday granted bail with conditions to actor Sreejith Ravi, arrested in connection with a POCSO case in Thrissur last week. It granted him bail considering the defence argument that Sreejith had been under treatment for behavioural disorder for last six years. He was arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park.

181.title: List of top 10 law colleges in India released by govt
181.article_body: The government has released list of top 10 law colleges in India. National Law School of India University in Bengaluru has been ranked the best law college in India, followed by National Law University in Delhi. Hyderabad's NALSAR University of Law has been ranked third, while Kolkata's The West Bengal National University of Juridical Sciences is fourth on the list.

182.title: Which are the top 10 engineering institutes in India as per govt rankings?
182.article_body: As per the National Institutional Ranking Framework Rankings 2022 released by the Centre on Friday, IIT Madras has been ranked the best institute for engineering in India. IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay, IIT Kanpur and IIT Kharagpur are among the top five engineering institutes. The other top engineering colleges include IIT Roorkee, IIT Guwahati and National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli.

183.title: 2 people arrested while trying to sell countrymade gun in Bengaluru
183.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Thursday said that it has arrested two people from Bihar who were trying to sell a countrymade gun in Bengaluru's Hebbal area. Police seized the pistol and six live rounds from them. While the main accused has been sent to judicial custody, the other person, believed to be a minor, is currently at a juvenile home.

184.title: Govt's 75-day free COVID-19 vaccine booster dose drive for all adults begins today
184.article_body: All adults (aged 18 years and above) will be able to get a free COVID-19 vaccine booster or precautionary shot across India for 75 days starting Friday (July 15). The drive was announced this week, with the Health Ministry urging states and Union Territories to "give an intensive and ambitious push towards full COVID-19 vaccination coverage".

185.title: B'wood will keep sinking as long as it has Kings, Sultans: Vivek Agnihotri
185.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a tweet stating, "Why Shah Rukh Khan is still 'king of Bollywood'" along with an article on the actor. The filmmaker wrote alongside the tweet, "As long as Bollywood has Kings, Badshahs, Sultans, it will keep sinking." He further wrote, "Make it people's industry with people's stories, it will lead the global film industry. #FACT."

186.title: Bloody brilliant: Tamannaah on Kangana's first look as Indira Gandhi
186.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share actress Kangana Ranaut's first look as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the upcoming film 'Emergency'. Tamannaah wrote alongside the poster of 'Emergency', "Bloody brilliant." The film is directed by Kangana and produced under her production house Manikarnika Films along with Renu Pitti.

187.title: SC grants bail to Pune man booked for murder of undertrial on parole
187.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to a man booked for killing another person, who was an undertrial in a murder case and was released from Pune's Yerwada Central Jail on provisional parole due to the COVID-19 outbreak in 2020. The murder of the undertrial prisoner allegedly took place over past enmity, the prosecution said.

188.title: 25 mn children missed out on life-saving vaccines due to COVID: WHO
188.article_body: Around 25 million children in 2021 missed vaccinations to protect them from life-threatening diseases because of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to data published by the WHO and UNICEF. This is two million more than those who missed out on vaccinations in 2020 and six million higher than in the pre-pandemic year 2019, the official data showed.

189.title: Sindhu advances to semis despite losing 1st set at Singapore Open
189.article_body: Indian badminton player PV Sindhu has advanced to the semi-final stage in the women's singles event of the Singapore Open 2022 after defeating China's Han Yue on Friday. Sindhu lost the first set against Yue yet she won the match by 17-21, 21-11 and 21-19. The 27-year-old shuttler will now meet Japan's Saena Kawakami on Saturday.

190.title: Teacher who died 4 years ago included in transfer list in U'khand, probe on
190.article_body: The name of a teacher who allegedly died four years ago was included in a transfer list of Uttarakhand education department. A probe has been ordered into the matter. While talking about the same, state Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said, "Transfer of deceased teacher has come to fore...which indicates gross negligence of departmental officers towards their functioning and responsibilities."

191.title: Jahangirpuri riots continuation of CAA, NRC protests: Delhi Police
191.article_body: The Jahangirpuri riots that took place in April were in continuation of the Shaheen Bagh protests against the CAA and NRC, and the 2020 north-east Delhi riots, said Delhi Police in a chargesheet. "20 out of 37 accused persons arrested were captured in CCTV footage and viral videos," said the chargesheet, adding that some are still absconding.

192.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe sworn in as Sri Lanka's acting Prez amid crisis
192.article_body: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as the country's acting President on Friday, his office said. Wickremesinghe had already taken on the role after former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country on Wednesday after months of protests. Notably, Sri Lanka's Parliament is scheduled to elect a new President on July 20.

193.title: Union minister unaware of ground realities on MGNREGA in Bengal: BJP
193.article_body: West Bengal's BJP unit claimed Union Minister Kapil Moreshwar Patil is unaware of the ground reality related to MGNREGA in the state. BJP national vice-president Dilip Ghosh alleged that officers have submitted misleading reports to Patil. This comes after Patil claimed that he doesn't know of any corruption in implementation of the scheme at the panchayat level in West Bengal.

194.title: If our kids can go to school at 7 am, why can't SC start at 9 am?: Justice Lalit
194.article_body: A Supreme Court bench on Friday began its sitting an hour earlier than usual, at 9.30 am. Justice UU Lalit, part of the bench and next in line to be Chief Justice of India, said, "Ideally we should sit at 9 [am]." He added, "If our children can go to school at 7 [am]...why can't we come at 9 am?"

195.title: Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner welcome 2nd child
195.article_body:
Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner have welcomed their second child, their representative told media. 
"Joe and Sophie are happy to announce the arrival of their baby girl," the representative stated. Joe and Sophie, who got married in Las Vegas back in 2019, previously welcomed daughter Willa in July 2020.

196.title: I heard story & felt I knew characters that were created: Ruchir on 'Ghar...'
196.article_body: Director Ruchir Arun said that when he heard script of 'Ghar Waapsi', he felt he knew the characters. "I felt like I was born in a house like the one in the story...I knew this father, this mother, the siblings...I knew this city and I knew this world. It was where I was born and I grew up," he added.

197.title: Govt releases list of top 10 medical colleges in India
197.article_body: As per the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) Rankings 2022, All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi has been named the best medical college in the country. It is followed by Chandigarh's Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research and Vellore's Christian Medical College. National Institute of Mental Health & Neuro Sciences, Bangalore is ranked fourth.

198.title: Let's be happy for them: Sushmita's ex-boyfriend Rohman on actress dating Lalit Modi
198.article_body: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl has reacted to the actress dating former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. "Let's be happy for them...Love is beautiful. All I know is if she has chosen someone, he is worth it!" he stated. Lalit Modi had shared pictures with Sushmita on Thursday and called her his "better looking partner".

199.title: KK's wife Jyothy Krishna paints a picture of late singer, shares it
199.article_body: KK's wife Jyothy Krishna has painted a picture of the late singer and posted it on social media. "Trying to paint again, Miss you sweetheart," she wrote with photo of the painting. KK passed away in May this year, after suffering a cardiac arrest in Kolkata after his performance.

200.title: RP Singh questions Kohli's absence from WI tour, says 'No one asked if we wanted to rest'
200.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has questioned Virat Kohli's absence from West Indies tour. He said, "When a player is going through a bad patch...he won't ask for rest. He should play more games as taking rest won't help him return to form." He added, "[During my time], no one asked if we wanted to rest...you either got selected or dropped."

201.title: Quite refreshing to know that Virat Kohli is a human: Jos Buttler
201.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli amid his poor form, England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said, "It's quite refreshing for the rest of us [to know] that Kohli is a human and he can have a couple of low scores as well." Buttler added, "Kohli has been one of the best players...if not the best player in ODI cricket in the world."

202.title: Union Minister shares video of Goa's Dudhsagar Falls, says 'Heaven meets Earth'
202.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy took to social media to share a video of Goa's Dudhsagar Falls. "Heaven meets Earth...It is one of the most beautiful scenic spots in the country. If you want to be smitten by nature's own miracle, visit the place for unforgettable memories!" he wrote. "It is wonderful nature's gift," a social media user commented.

203.title: Alt News' Mohammed Zubair granted bail in 2018 tweet case
203.article_body: Fact-checker and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has been granted bail by a Delhi court in connection with the case over his 2018 tweet in which he allegedly hurt religious sentiments. Zubair will, however, remain in jail over two cases filed in Uttar Pradesh. The court said that the 33-year-old cannot leave the country without prior permission from the court.

204.title: It is a tough film to make: Anil Kapoor on Abhinav Bindra's biopic
204.article_body: Anil Kapoor has reacted to rumours claiming his upcoming movie based on the life of Olympic gold-medalist Abhinav Bindra has been shelved. "Bindra was always happening...but it's a tough film to make...It needs a lot of planning," he said. "All good filmmakers work on scripts for years to make them happen," Anil said, adding, "I plan to start...[it] by 2023."

205.title: Waiting for approval: B'luru school booked for running 'illegally'
205.article_body: Days after Bengaluru's Orchids International School was booked for illegally functioning without approval and authorisation, the school said they have sought necessary permissions from the state education department. "We're hopeful to receive the permission shortly," it said in a statement. The Block Education Officer said it is doubtful the school would be allowed to function this academic year.

206.title: Govt releases list of top 10 management institutes in India
206.article_body: The government on Friday released the NIRF Ranking 2022 for management institutes, with Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad emerging as the top management institute in the country. It was followed by IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi and IIM Kozhikode. IIM Lucknow has been ranked 6th, IIM Indore 7th and XLRI Jamshedpur 8th.

207.title: Will prove our position in court & we believe we'll prevail: Twitter CEO to staff
207.article_body: Following a lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion acquisition agreement, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told his staff, "We will prove our position in court and we believe we will prevail." Twitter's lawsuit has accused Musk of "a long list" of violations of the merger agreement that "cast a pall over Twitter and its business".

208.title: 3 men arrested for gangrape of 16-year-old girl in a moving car in Delhi
208.article_body: Three men have been arrested over alleged gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in a moving car, police said on Friday. The Class 10 girl reportedly told the police that she was in a market with two of the men, who spiked her drink and took her into a car brought by the third accused. The accused reportedly recorded the crime.

209.title: Oscar-winning make-up artist said I resemble Indira Gandhi a lot: Kangana
209.article_body: Kangana Ranaut said Oscar-winning make-up artist David Malinowski, who worked on her look for the upcoming film 'Emergency', pointed out that she "physically [resembles] Mrs (Indira) Gandhi a lot, including...skin texture and jawline". "I told him in India, people believe I'm the perfect person to play Mrs Gandhi," she added. Kangana further said David and his team are astute professionals.

210.title: Dropping Willey's catch was key moment: Giles on India's loss by 100 runs
210.article_body: After India lost to England by 100 runs on Thursday, former English spinner Ashley Giles said that India dropping the catch of England's David Willey was a "key moment" in the match. "Willey was on 1 and went on to get 40-odd at close to a run-a-ball...Both Willey and Reece Topley upfront carried that momentum into India's batting," Giles said.

211.title: Europe shot itself in the lungs with Russia sanctions: Hungary PM
211.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said Europe has "shot itself in the lungs" by imposing sanctions on Russia over Ukraine war. "The sanctions don't help Ukraine, however, they're bad for the European economy and if it goes on like this, they'll kill off the European economy," he added. "The sanctions policy was based on wrong assumptions and...must be changed," he said.

212.title: PMC to take action against contractors over potholes on roads
212.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to take action against contractors responsible for the roads built before the monsoon season which have now developed potholes. A list of the affected roads has been prepared, PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner (Estate) Kunal Khemnar said. "PMC should ask...contractors responsible to clear these potholes and also impose a fine on them," he added.

213.title: Body of Telangana journalist who was washed away in floodwaters found
213.article_body: The body of a Telangana journalist who went missing after his car was washed away in flood waters in Jagtial district has been found. His body was found after a rescue operation that lasted for over 48 hours. Reports said that his body was found stuck in a tree. The rescue team also pulled out a badly mangled car.

214.title: Probe ordered against 33 govt schools in J'khand for giving weekly off on Friday
214.article_body: A probe has been ordered against 33 government schools in Jharkhand's Dumka for giving Friday as their weekly off instead of Sunday. "We've written...to Block education officers...All the schools have 'Urdu' in their names," an official said. "It's being investigated how Urdu is tied to these institutions...under what conditions a weekly holiday on Friday is being offered," the official added.

215.title: Cyberabad police shares accident video, says 'Don't jump divider'
215.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police shared a video of an accident that took place in Narsingi and urged people to not cross the road from median bushes and by jumping the divider. "Fortunately, pedestrian survived with simple injuries," the traffic police said. The video shows a pedestrian getting hit by a car after he jumped over the road median.

216.title: Rohit struggles against swinging deliveries of left-arm seamers: Jaffer
216.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer has said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma struggles against "left-arm seamers when the ball swings". "Reece Topley bowled really well. Even the shot Rohit played before he got out was loose as well," Jaffer said. "Shikhar Dhawan still looks rusty. He hasn't found his touch because he hasn't played a lot of cricket," he added.

217.title: Military use outdated, solve issues peacefully: Dalai Lama tells India, China
217.article_body: The Dalai Lama on Friday advocated a peaceful resolution to the ongoing tensions between India and China along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in eastern Ladakh. "India and China are both competitive nations and neighbours, sooner or later you have to solve this problem through talks and peaceful means. The use of military force is outdated," Dalai Lama said.

218.title: Govt releases advisory as India reports its 1st case of monkeypox
218.article_body: The government has released an advisory after India's first monkeypox case was reported in Kerala. Government said people travelling abroad should avoid contact with sick people, including those with skin and genital lesions. "Avoid contact with dead rats, squirrels and monkeys," government added. "Consult nearest health facility if you develop symptoms suggestive of monkeypox," it further said.

219.title: If kids can go to school at 7 am, SC can start at 9 am: Justice Lalit
219.article_body: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit said if kids can go to school at 7 am, the Supreme Court judges and lawyers can also start their day at 9 am. He began hearing cases an hour before the usual time on Friday. Justice Lalit earlier said SC benches should start at 9 am and rise at 11.30 am for a half-hour break.

220.title: Initially I thought the makers were just kidding: Mithali on 'Shabaash...'
220.article_body: Discussing 'Shabaash Mithu' which is a biopic on her, ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj said, "Initially, I thought [the makers] were...kidding, but when...[they] told me in detail, I realised this is reality." "[The film] has been an emotional ride," read a tweet from Mithali. "Cricket wasn't a part of my vision. It was dad's decision," Mithali had shared.

221.title: WB man kills brother for 'abusing' mother in front of neighbours
221.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing his brother to death on Thursday to keep their mother's "honour" in West Bengal's Murshidabad. Reportedly, the deceased had abused his mother in front of neighbours when she refused to give him money to buy alcohol. The accused asked the deceased to stop but the latter paid no heed, a neighbour claimed.

222.title: Twitter-Musk case to be overseen by Delaware business court's 1st female chief judge
222.article_body: The first female chief judge on Delaware’s business court will oversee Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating the $44 billion acquisition agreement. Kathaleen McCormick took over the role of chancellor, or chief judge, last year. McCormick's final ruling on the merger can be appealed to the Delaware Supreme Court.

223.title: Unable to pay for hotel, Lonavala man steals ₹1.2 lakh from colleague, held
223.article_body: MIDC Police have arrested a man from Lonavala for allegedly stealing ₹1.2 lakh from his colleague after he was unable to pay for two hotel rooms where he and his family stayed for 15 days. Reports said that the man would spend his salary on shopping and alcohol and would later rely on his siblings.

224.title: China willing to recalibrate ties with Australia: Foreign Min
224.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said that China is willing to "recalibrate" its relationship with Australia after several years of tensions over national security and trade. He added that Australia should "correct" its understanding of China for relations to set sail again and also refrain from joining in with others in trying to contain China.

225.title: Will is gay & he does love Mike: Noah on his Stranger Things' character
225.article_body: 'Stranger Things' actor Noah Schnapp confirmed that his character Will Byers is gay on the show. He added Will is in love with his friend Mike Wheeler, played by Finn Wolfhard, but doesn't want to hurt Eleven's feelings by confessing it. Noah further said Will is scared to come out and doesn't know if he'll be accepted by his friends.

226.title: Sanjeev was rejected for Khana Khazana, channel said 'We want woman': Hansal
226.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta revealed that ZeeTV had initially declined to take Sanjeev Kapoor as the host of their cookery show, 'Khana Khazana'. "They said, 'We want a woman. Housewives want someone relatable, a woman cooking, not a man'," he added. Hansal further said the show did not take off with the female chef-host.

227.title: Bihar woman stabbed in eyes while resisting rape by neighbour
227.article_body: A 45-year-old woman in Bihar's Katihar was allegedly stabbed in both eyes with a pointed wooden or iron object as she resisted a rape attempt by a neighbour. The incident took place when the accused took her away while she slept in her mud-and-thatched house with her 11-year-old daughter. "Her retina is damaged...The woman can barely see," said a doctor.

228.title: US House passes amendment approving sanctions waiver to India over Russia deal
228.article_body: The US House of Representatives has passed by voice vote a legislative amendment that approves waiver to India against the CAATSA sanctions for its purchase of the S-400 missile defence system from Russia. However, this is not yet a part of the law. The amendment was introduced by Indian-American Congressman Ro Khanna.

229.title: He has never been more desperate to score: Ojha after Kohli's 16(25)
229.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said Virat Kohli has "never been more desperate to score runs" following his dismissal for 16 off 25 balls in the second ODI against England. "There's been a lot of talk around his lack of form and he...would also be thinking about it a lot," added Ojha. "Kohli [is] chasing the outside off deliveries," he stated.

230.title: SC rejects plea for probe into 'extra-judicial' killings of Chhattisgarh tribals
230.article_body: Supreme Court dismissed a 2009 petition seeking a probe into alleged extra-judicial killings of 17 tribals by security forces during anti-Naxal operations in Chhattisgarh. A tribal rights activist had filed a PIL seeking an independent investigation into the killings. "We're not proceeding with perjury...it's open to the state government to include charges like criminal conspiracy etc," SC stated.

231.title: IndiGo Delhi-Vadodara flight diverted to Jaipur after glitch in engine
231.article_body: An IndiGo flight from Delhi to Vadodara was diverted to Jaipur on Thursday night. The diversion was a precautionary measure following vibrations in the engine for a fraction of a second. An alternate flight was arranged for the onward journey of the passengers. Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said that they have ordered a probe into the matter.

232.title: SP-ally OP Rajbhar's party to support NDA's Prez candidate Droupadi Murmu
232.article_body: Om Prakash Rajbhar's Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP), an ally of the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party (SP), announced on Friday that it will be supporting NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential elections. "The decision was taken after discussions with party leaders and office bearers," Rajbhar said. Notably, Akhilesh Yadav is supporting Yashwant Sinha for Presidential polls.

233.title: Govt releases list of top 10 universities in India
233.article_body: The Ministry of Education on Friday released the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) Rankings 2022, according to which Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru has attained the first position. JNU, Delhi has been ranked second, followed by Jamia Millia Islamia, Delhi, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, Coimbatore and Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi.

234.title: Which are the top 10 colleges in India according to 2022 rankings released by govt?
234.article_body: According to the NIRF India Rankings 2022, Miranda House-Delhi has been ranked 1st in 'College' category, followed by Hindu College-Delhi, Presidency College-Chennai, Loyola College-Chennai and Lady Shri Ram College for Women-Delhi. PSGR Krishnammal College for Women-Coimbatore has been ranked 6th, Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College-Delhi (7th) and St Xavier's College-Kolkata (8th).

235.title: Man kills and boils his wife in front of his 6 children in Pakistan
235.article_body: A man has allegedly killed and boiled his wife in a cauldron in front of his six children in Pakistan's Sindh province. Police said they found Nargis' body in a cauldron in the kitchen of a private school, where her husband Ashiq worked as a watchman. The police said the victim's 15-year-old daughter called them.

236.title: Wife Sunita is preparing but I have done no prep: Anil on being a grandparent
236.article_body: Soon-to-be grandfather actor Anil Kapoor said his wife Sunita Kapoor is preparing for the role of being a grandparent but that he has done no preparation. "I think this is a role...I can't prepare for. I have to be very spontaneous about it...I really want D-Day to happen, and then I'll tell you how I feel about it," he added.

237.title: Tried hitting Messi to bring him down but failed to stop him: Del Piero
237.article_body: Juventus legend Alessandro Del Piero said he tried "hitting" Lionel Messi in order to bring him down during a match but failed to stop him. "He was unbelievable," added Del Piero. "It was something very beautiful to see," he stated. "Messi is the very essence of football and we're lucky that he's playing in our time," Del Piero had shared.

238.title: Sweden hands life sentence to ex-Iranian official over prison executions
238.article_body: A Swedish court has sentenced a former Iranian official to life in prison for participating in the mass execution and torture of political prisoners in Iran in 1988. Hamid Nouri was arrested at a Stockholm airport in 2019 and was tried under the principle of universal jurisdiction. Iran said that "Nouri's sentence was politically motivated and...has no legal validity".

239.title: Would've been great if tri-series was played among Ind, Eng, SA: Jaffer
239.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that it would have been "great for fans" had a tri-series between India, England and South Africa was scheduled instead of the ongoing bilateral series. "SA are in England. Their ODI series starts on 19th July. England-India ODI series finishes on 17th July...this could have been a really good tri-series," Jaffer tweeted.

240.title: Jewellery worth ₹13 lakh stolen from Air Force officer's house in Chandigarh
240.article_body: Police have registered a case after jewellery worth ₹13 lakh was found stolen from an Air Force officer's house in Chandigarh. Pratima Mishra, wife of Wing Commander Hemant Kumar Mishra, said she lived with her two daughters at their house in Sector-49. Pratima has raised suspicion on her domestic help as she did not report to work on multiple days.

241.title: Shameful: SC to Nagaland for delaying women's reservation in local bodies
241.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday criticised Nagaland government for delaying the implementation of 33% reservation for women in urban local bodies, saying, "It's shameful to defeat the [rights] of women like this." Noting that the state had made a law for the reservation in 2016, the bench added, "We've no trust in the state government...How can any welfare state do this?"

242.title: Scored double century despite immense pain: Gavaskar on 1971 WI tour
242.article_body: Discussing India's last Test against West Indies during their tour of West Indies in 1971, Sunil Gavaskar said, "Ice got into the cavity of my tooth and it was so painful!" "[I was forbidden] from taking...sleeping tablets or any painkillers...I...[got a double hundred in the second innings having scored] a century in the first innings as well," he added.

243.title: Actor-director Pratap Pothen found dead at his home in Chennai
243.article_body: Actor-director Pratap Pothen was found dead in his apartment in Chennai on Friday. A police officer said that as per initial reports he had died of natural health causes and Kilpauk Police will investigate the case further. The 69-year-old had worked in more than 100 films in Tamil, Malayalam, Telugu and Hindi.

244.title: JEE Main 2022 topper Navya says he will retake exam
244.article_body: Navya Hisaria, who scored 100 percentile in the Joint Engineering Examination (JEE) Main 2022 session 1, has said he will retake the exam. "These JEE Main attempts teach me how to complete the paper within the given timeframe and manage the time well. It is like a practice," he further said.

245.title: 3 injured in clash between 2 communities over biryani shop in UP
245.article_body: Three people were injured after a clash took place between members of two communities when a municipal corporation team was clearing encroachment by a biryani shop in the Prem Nagar area of Bareilly, UP. The shop owner Nawab Ali and a local BJP leader Ankit Bhatia got into an argument, which later turned violent, during the anti-encroachment drive, police said.

246.title: Musk's father confirms 2nd child with stepdaughter, says 'We're on Earth to reproduce'
246.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk's father, Errol, has revealed that he welcomed a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout, in 2019. Errol, 76, who already has a five-year-old boy with Jana, said, "The only thing we're on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol said that they are no longer living together owing to their 41-year age gap.

247.title: Sushmita Sen's 11-yr-old tweet thanking Lalit Modi for 'blue tick' on Twitter goes viral
247.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's 11-year-old tweet thanking former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi for helping her get blue verification tick on Twitter is going viral. "Yippppeeee!!! Finally my twitter acc is verified!! Thank you Lalit(Modi):) for all your help! Sooooo much for a tick mark;) party time," she had tweeted. Earlier, Lalit Modi confirmed that they are in a relationship.

248.title: Was repeatedly told to introduce songs, fights: Madhavan on 'Rocketry...'
248.article_body: Discussing his recent film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' which is a biopic on former scientist Nambi Narayanan, R Madhavan said, "I was repeatedly told to introduce songs and fights into Nambi sir's story." "Can you imagine Nambi sir singing and dancing and fighting? Sorry, I would have preferred to not make the film rather than dilute [his] story," added Madhavan.

249.title: This isn't Germany: Kamal Haasan on 'unparliamentary' words list
249.article_body: Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) chief Kamal Haasan in a statement on Thursday condemned the list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, saying, "Mr Hitler, this isn't Germany!" He questioned if the PM and his ministers aren't open to criticism, then does it mean "we're going back to [a] monarchy where...king and his ministers would be only praised?"

250.title: HMDA to build Landscape Park worth ₹35 cr near Hyderabad's Osman Sagar
250.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) is planning to build a Landscape Park near Osman Sagar, at a cost of around ₹35.60 crore. Spread over an area of 5.5 acres, the park is expected to be completed by Dussehra this year. The facility will also have a food court, restrooms, a children's play area, picnic areas and inner access roads.

251.title: Mumbai civic body to prepare SOP with BEST, MSRTC for stranded commuters
251.article_body: Mumbai civic commissioner IS Chahal has directed the officials to prepare an SOP with Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport and Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation to prevent commuters from getting stranded. Chahal asked officials to provide first aid assistance as well. The decision was taken following CM Eknath Shinde's directions on the same due to Mumbai's incessant rains.

252.title: Musk's father welcomes 2nd child with stepdaughter, says 'We are on Earth to reproduce’
252.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk’s father, Errol, has revealed that he welcomed a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout in 2019. Errol, 76, who already has a five-year-old boy with Jana, said "The only thing we're on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol said that they are no longer living together owing to their 41-year age gap.

253.title: Trying to save her: Assam CM on teen arrested over 'anti-national' poem
253.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday said that the 19-year-old college student, Barshashree Buragohain, was arrested for wanting to join the militant group ULFA(I) and not for posting an "anti-national" poem. "She is our daughter. We're trying to save her," he added. "If her parents...take responsibility that she will not join ULFA(I), she will be released," Sarma stated.

254.title: 'Over mature' 150-yr-old heritage tree uprooted from Chandigarh school
254.article_body: A 150-year-old heritage tree, after being deemed "over mature" in a survey, has been uprooted from Chandigarh's Vatika School for Deaf and Dumb Children. This came after another heritage tree had recently fallen in another city school, causing death of one student and injuries to several others. The tree had been earlier pruned, an official said.

255.title: Belgian Deputy PM resigns to take care of ill husband
255.article_body: Belgian Deputy PM and Foreign Minister, Sophie Wilmes, has resigned to take care of her husband, former Australian footballer Chris Stone, who has been diagnosed with brain cancer. She'd temporarily stepped down in April for the same reason. "My husband's illness will be a difficult battle that I want to fight alongside him and...our children," Wilmes said in a statement.

256.title: Kangana Ranaut reveals first look as Indira Gandhi for 'Emergency'
256.article_body: The teaser of 'Emergency' was unveiled on Thursday, revealing Kangana Ranaut's look as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi for the upcoming project. "Presenting 'Her' who was called 'Sir'," Kangana wrote while sharing the teaser on her Instagram handle and added that she has started shooting for the film. In addition to acting in it, Kangana is also directing the film.

257.title: Schools to remain closed today & tomorrow in Pimpri Chinchwad
257.article_body: All civic and private schools will remain closed today and tomorrow in Pimpri Chinchwad as per the District Collector's directives, PCMC Deputy Commissioner Sandip Khot said. "We have over 650 civic and private schools," he added. However, the PMC said that schools in its area will remain open today. This comes as the Pune district has been witnessing heavy rainfall.

258.title: Complete dictatorship: O Panneerselvam after AIADMK expels OP Ravindhranath
258.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam has termed AIADMK's decision of expelling his son and Theni Lok Sabha MP OP Ravindhranath "complete dictatorship". "In...last General Election 2019, OP Ravindhranath won and that is the only seat where AIADMK won. Removing [him] is a complete dictatorship," said O Panneerselvam. His other son, VP Jayapradeep, was also expelled from AIADMK on Thursday.

259.title: Like all firms, we are not immune to economic headwinds: Google CEO to staff
259.article_body: In an internal memo to the staff, Google CEO Sundar Pichai while announcing the company’s plan to slow its hiring, said, "Like all companies, we’re not immune to economic headwinds". He added, “The uncertain global economic outlook has been top of mind...We’ve never viewed these types of challenges as obstacles. Instead, we’ve seen them as opportunities to deepen our focus."

260.title: Google to slow hiring for rest of the year: CEO Pichai tells employees
260.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an internal memo to the staff has announced that they will be "slowing down the pace of hiring for the rest of the year" amid an uncertain global economic outlook. He added, Google will focus on hiring for "critical roles" and will be "pausing development" in some cases and "re-deploying resources to higher priority areas".

261.title: Only regret not winning the WC, wish I could replay 2017 WC final: Mithali
261.article_body: Ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj has tweeted she only regrets not winning the World Cup, adding she wishes she could replay the ICC Women's World Cup 2017 final, which India lost against England. "[I wish I could] take the team across the line and lift that trophy," added Mithali. England defeated India by nine runs in the final.

262.title: Actress Constance Wu reveals she attempted suicide after 'internet shaming' in 2019
262.article_body: Actress Constance Wu, best known for her role in 'Crazy Rich Asians', has revealed that she attempted suicide after facing social media backlash over her "careless" tweets in 2019. She said that the tweets "ignited outrage and internet shaming that got pretty severe". "Luckily, a friend found me and rushed me to the ER," she further said.

263.title: Life with mom was a fantasy, haven't dealt with her loss: Janhvi on Sridevi
263.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said living when her mother and late actress Sridevi was around was a fantasy and she has not dealt with her loss completely. "The reality that I am living now is so anchored. It feels secure only because of Arjun Bhaiya and Anshula didi...it almost hurts to remember the person...I was because it was different," she added.

264.title: US lawyer, accused of plotting his own death, charged with wife & son's murder
264.article_body: US lawyer Alex Murdaugh has been charged with the murder of his wife and son. Murdaugh's wife Margaret and son Paul were killed on June 7, 2021. Almost three months after their deaths, Murdaugh was arrested and charged for allegedly planning his own killing so that his surviving son, Buster Murdaugh, could receive a $10 million insurance payout.

265.title: Ajmer Dargah cleric arrested from Hyderabad for provocative speech
265.article_body: The Rajasthan Police arrested an Ajmer Dargah cleric (khadim) from Hyderabad for allegedly delivering a provocative speech shortly before a rally being taken out against the former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma last month. The accused, Gohar Chishti, will be brought to Ajmer on transit remand, police said. Notably, four others, who were there at the rally, have also been arrested.

266.title: Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker accepts Rajapaksa's resignation
266.article_body: Sri Lanka's Parliamentary Speaker on Friday said that he has accepted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation letter after verifying its authenticity. "From this point, we will move to constitutionally appoint a new President," Speaker Mahinda Abeywardena added. Rajapaksa resigned on Thursday after fleeing to Singapore amid mass protests over the ongoing economic crisis in the island nation.

267.title: Leptospirosis cases could rise in Mumbai, take treatment if infected: BMC
267.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has warned that leptospirosis cases could rise due to the heavy rainfall that has been lashing the city. According to reports, BMC has also asked people to not wade in water. "If exposed, take prophylactic treatment (such as doxycycline/azithromycin) as per medical advice," an advisory from the civic body reportedly said.

268.title: Kerala becomes the only state with its own internet service: CM Vijayan
268.article_body: Kerala has become the only state in India with its own internet service, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Thursday. "The Kerala Fiber Optic Network Limited has received the ISP license from the Centre's Department of Telecommunications," he added. With this, Kerala's KFON project can kickstart its operations of providing internet as a basic right to our people, Vijayan further said.

269.title: Babar is way ahead of Kohli, can't understand comparisons: Imam Ul Haq
269.article_body: Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq said Babar Azam is "way ahead" of Virat Kohli currently, adding he can't understand comparisons between them. "At the end of their careers, I want Babar to score three to four thousand runs more than Kohli in every format," added Imam. "I feel that [Kohli doesn't have the same talent as Rohit Sharma]," he stated.

270.title: Massive fire breaks out at restaurant in Delhi's Connaught Place
270.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a restaurant 'Cafe High5' in Connaught Place's Outer Circle in Delhi. "Total of six fire tenders were rushed to the site. Fire is brought under control and so far no one is injured," Delhi Fire Service officials said. Reportedly, the fire occurred in a piece of furniture in the restaurant on the first floor.

271.title: India reports 20,038 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,39,073
271.article_body: India has reported 20,038 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,139 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,39,073, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,604, according to the latest data.

272.title: No plans for company-wide layoffs: Twitter amid lawsuit against Musk
272.article_body: In a filing, Twitter has said that it isn't looking at company-wide layoffs but could continue to restructure the business. The filing comes a day after it sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal. In May, Twitter said it would pause hiring and review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".

273.title: Live with parents, wanted to write what I can do in front of them: Amit Tandon
273.article_body: Comedian Amit Tandon said he has done "edgy" stuff before but he lives with his parents so he wanted to write what he could do in front of them too. "However, like movies, comedy too has all kinds of genres. And while some of them you'd love watching with family, others you can watch alone with headphones on," he added.

274.title: We'll break records, everyone will vote for Murmu: Maha CM Shinde
274.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde claimed on Thursday that in the upcoming Presidential polls, all records will be broken as everyone will vote for NDA's candidate, Droupadi Murmu, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance. "Murmu is a tribal woman. We work for tribals and we support tribal people," he said. Murmu had met Shinde and other leaders the same day.

275.title: Reece Topley records best-ever bowling figures by an England bowler in men's ODI history
275.article_body: England fast bowler Reece Topley on Thursday recorded the best-ever bowling figures by an England bowler in men's ODI cricket history. The 28-year-old registered figures of 9.5-2-24-6 against India in the second ODI at Lord's to break the record. The previous record was held by Paul Collingwood, who recorded figures of 10-1-31-6 against Bangladesh in an ODI in 2005.

276.title: Dhanush attends The Gray Man premiere with sons Linga & Yathra, shares pics
276.article_body: Actor Dhanush attended the premiere of 'The Gray Man' in Los Angeles on Wednesday, along with his sons Linga and Yathra. He shared some pictures from the premiere on his Instagram handle and wrote, "When you realise they've completely stolen the show from you. At #TheGrayMan premiere with Yathra, Linga." Dhanush plays an assassin named Avik San in the film.

277.title: 17-yr-old Mumbai boy blows off courier parcel to claim insurance, detained
277.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a 17-year-old boy for allegedly blowing off a courier parcel to avail insurance benefits. Reports said that the minor had booked a courier service to Delhi on the pretext of sending a consignment of electronics, claiming to be valued at ₹9.81 lakh. Reports added that he had packed the courier with junk and an incendiary device.

278.title: Rupee edges closer to 80 per US dollar, opens at record low of 79.94
278.article_body: The rupee on Friday opened at a record low of 79.94 against the US dollar. So far this year, the US dollar is up 7% against the Indian currency. On Thursday, the currency had closed at another record low of 79.90 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex jumped 316 points to 53,733 in Friday's early session.

279.title: Why is this discussion happening, I can't understand: Rohit to journalist on Kohli's form
279.article_body: After a journalist started his question on Virat Kohli saying that a lot of discussion is happening over Kohli's form, India captain Rohit Sharma responded, "Why is this discussion happening, I can't understand." Rohit added that Kohli doesn't need reassurance as he is a great batter. "He only needs one or two good innings to bounce back," Rohit further stated.

280.title: What is 'Turkey teeth', the dental trend UK doctors have warned people against?
280.article_body: UK doctors have warned people against "Turkey teeth", the dental trend that involves travelling abroad to get cut-price treatment. The procedure is leaving hundreds of Britishers with serious complications. It involves filing the teeth to pegs and then replacing them with crowns or veneers. Patients can choose the shape, material and colour of these caps.

281.title: Wore every piece of clothing I had, lips turned blue: Janhvi on trip with Sara
281.article_body: While talking about a trip that she took with actress Sara Ali Khan, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she wore every piece of clothing she had on the trip and that her lips turned blue from the cold weather. "I had travelled to Kedarnath with two thermals, one puffer jacket, three shawls, two-track pants and two sweaters," she added.

282.title: Elon has a real record of success: LinkedIn Co-founder defends Musk against Trump
282.article_body: LinkedIn's billionaire Co-founder Reid Hoffman defended Tesla CEO Elon Musk after former US President Donald Trump called the former a "bullshit artist" over the $44 billion Twitter deal. Hoffman tweeted, "Elon's a classic American immigrant story- an entrepreneur with a real record of success…[Whereas] Trump is a spoiled rich kid who bankrupts everything he touches. Including the US economy."

283.title: I am done being called a diva or fashionista: Nia Sharma
283.article_body: Actress Nia Sharma, known for shows like 'Naagin' and 'Twisted 2', has said she wants people to recognise her as an artist now, adding that she's done being called a diva or a fashionista or someone who's known for her looks. Nia further said she wants to be known as someone "who can instantly be considered for a performance-oriented role".

284.title: 2 held for stealing lorry carrying ₹38 lakh-soap bars: Rachakonda Police
284.article_body: Two interstate offenders were arrested for allegedly stealing a lorry which was carrying soap bars worth over ₹38 lakh from Maheshwaram, the Rachakonda Police tweeted on Friday. The accused along with two others had decided to steal the goods by diverting the vehicles delivering them, according to the police. The lorry, worth ₹15 lakh, was also recovered, the police said.

285.title: Removal of Mangalsutra by wife is mental cruelty of highest order: High Court
285.article_body: While granting divorce to a couple, Madras High Court has observed that removal of 'thali' (Mangalsutra) by a wife would amount to subjecting husband to mental cruelty of the highest order. "Thali around the neck of a woman was a sacred thing which symbolises the continuance of married life and it's removed only after the husband's death," the court said.

286.title: 105 kg red sandalwood worth ₹3.15 lakh seized in B'luru; 1 arrested
286.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly smuggling 105 kg red sandalwood worth about ₹3.15 lakh in Bengaluru's Kengeri on Thursday. The seizure was made after the police stopped a red car at a regular checkpoint. While one person was taken into custody, the police are trying to catch the others who managed to escape while being questioned.

287.title: BBMP ex-corporator's husband stabbed to death over mosque presidentship
287.article_body: BBMP ex-corporator Nazima Khanam's husband died on Thursday after being stabbed by his nephew over the issue of heading a mosque committee. According to Khanam, her husband, Ayub Khan, was the President of a mosque in Bengaluru's Tippu Nagar for last 15 years. However, Ayub's nephew wanted to be the President which regularly led to arguments between them, Khanam added.

288.title: Dalit gang-rape survivor run over by bike in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, loses leg
288.article_body: A Dalit gang-rape survivor from Uttar Pradesh's Mathura lost her left leg after she was allegedly run over by a bike by the accused and was left abandoned near a railway track. After an FIR was filed, two of the accused were arrested. They made her consume an intoxicant before allegedly raping her while she was going to a bank.

289.title: Govt mulls imposing fines for not wearing masks in Bengaluru
289.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar has said that the government is considering imposing fines on people not wearing masks in public places in Bengaluru. "I feel that masks have to be made compulsory at least in Bengaluru," he said. "We may have to think about imposing fines on people also before it gets out of hand," he added.

290.title: 65-year-old woman robbed, murdered at her home in Pune; 1 booked
290.article_body: A case has been filed against one person after a 65-year-old woman was robbed and murdered at her house in Pune's Katraj. The accused allegedly strangled the deceased, who lived alone, to death and stole the jewellery she was wearing along with some cash from the house. The incident occurred on the intervening night of July 11 and July 12.

291.title: Elon Musk's mother shares pics from his startup Zip2's opening event from 1997
291.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk took to Twitter to share pictures of the opening of Zip2's global headquarters in Mountain View, California, in 1997. Zip2, a web software startup that created online city guides for newspapers, was the first company founded by Elon Musk. Earlier, a picture of Musk's 1995 business card of Zip2 went viral on Twitter.

292.title: It's been for a long time: Rohit on long tail in batting being an issue
292.article_body: Talking about whether India's long tail in batting is an issue, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "That has been...for a long time now...We do understand we have a long tail." England defeated India by 100 runs in the second ODI with Rohit dismissed for a duck. "Not that the target [of 247] wasn't chaseable...We just didn't bat well," added Rohit.

293.title: Ripudaman Singh Malik, acquitted in 1985 Air India bombing, shot dead in Canada
293.article_body: Ripudaman Singh Malik, who was acquitted in the 1985 Air India Kanishka bombing case, was shot dead in Canada's British Columbia on Thursday, Canadian news outlets reported. Witness said that three shots were heard and Malik was hit in the neck. The bombing took place in Montreal-Delhi Air India Flight 182, Emperor Kanishka, in 1985, killing all 329 onboard.

294.title: Italian President rejects PM Mario Draghi’s resignation
294.article_body: Italian President Sergio Mattarella has rejected the resignation of the country's PM Mario Draghi. The former head of the European Central Bank had tendered his resignation after populist coalition partner Five Star withdrew its support in a confidence vote, which he won. President Mattarella has also asked Draghi to address Parliament to provide a clear picture of the political situation.

295.title: 159 kids rescued from begging under Operation Muskaan in Hyderabad
295.article_body: A total of 159 children were rescued from begging on Hyderabad streets under the eighth phase of 'Operation Muskaan'. Out of these, 135 were boys and 24 were girls hailing from several states, Hyderabad City Police informed on Thursday. Further, 12 FIRs were registered against shop owners where children aged between five and 18 years were working, police added.

296.title: Twitter uses Musk's old poop reaction to CEO's tweet as evidence in court, he reacts
296.article_body: Twitter has used Tesla CEO Elon Musk's poop reaction to one of CEO Parag Agrawal's tweets on spam accounts in May as evidence against him in court. The Twitter lawsuit alleged that Musk has repeatedly disparaged Twitter and created business risk for the company. Meanwhile, reacting to this, Musk used another poop emoji and wrote, "= bs".

297.title: IMD issues orange alert for Pune for Friday; rainfall intensity to reduce
297.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an orange alert for Pune for Friday. "Rainfall intensity over most parts of Maharashtra will reduce from Friday onwards," IMD said. Some parts of Pune recorded 70 mm of rainfall on Thursday, the season's highest so far, IMD added. Southwest Monsoon will remain active over west, central and peninsular India till July 18, IMD stated.

298.title: Pakistan captain Babar Azam's 'Stay strong' tweet for Virat Kohli goes viral
298.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam took to Twitter to write in support of Virat Kohli amid the latter's poor form. Sharing a picture of himself with Kohli, Babar wrote, "This too shall pass. Stay strong." Kohli was dismissed for 16(25) in the second ODI against England after having scored 12 runs in the two T20Is against England.

299.title: Rohit dislocates his elbow, pops it back in himself while fielding; video goes viral
299.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma dislocating his elbow and popping it back in himself while fielding in the second ODI against England at Lord's. In the video, Rohit can be seen having a laugh with Jadeja after popping his elbow back in. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Rohit giving orthopaedic lessons while playing."

300.title: Ivana Trump, first wife of Donald Trump, passes away
300.article_body: Ivana Trump, former US President Donald Trump's first wife and the mother of three of his children, has died aged 73. "She was a wonderful, beautiful, and amazing woman, who led a great and inspirational life," Trump posted on his social media platform Truth Social. Ivana married Trump in 1977. They divorced 15 years later in 1992.

301.title: Delhi Traffic Police gets 450 body cams, 700 bikes to catch those speeding
301.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued 450 body cameras and 700 bikes to its staff in charge of catching people who are speeding or not wearing seat belts and other such offences. The cameras are attached to the uniform, police said. The traffic police in the national capital has divided its personnel into teams to look into traffic regulation, enforcement and prosecution.

302.title: HC allows Pune woman relocating abroad to take daughter with her
302.article_body: Bombay HC has allowed a Pune-based woman, who is embroiled in a matrimonial dispute with her husband, to relocate to Poland along with her nine-year-old daughter. "I don't think that the court can refuse...job prospects to a mother...she cannot be deprived of this opportunity," the judge said. The father should be allowed to virtually contact the child daily, court said.

303.title: B'luru Police arrest 6 for stealing gold, silver worth ₹22.5 lakh
303.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested six people accused of robbing jewellery and recovered 400 grams of gold ornaments and 3.5 kg of silver ornaments, the combined value of which is over ₹22 lakh, police said. Police said they also seized a car used to carry out the crime as well as ₹64,000 in cash. A weapon was also found, reports said.

304.title: Driver dies by suicide in Gurugram after wife elopes with neighbour
304.article_body: A cab driver died by suicide in Gurugram three days after his wife allegedly eloped with a neighbour, according to reports. The deceased had also reportedly filed a complaint against his wife and her lover with IMT Manesar police station before taking the extreme step. The deceased worked in a private company and drove an Ola cab.

305.title: Woman forced to undergo abortion 14 times, kills self in Delhi
305.article_body: A 33-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after being compelled to undergo abortion 14 times in a span of eight years by her boyfriend, who was also her live-in partner, police said. The deceased wrote in her suicide note that her partner had refused to marry her. A case of abetment of suicide has been registered against the man.

306.title: India lose an ODI under Rohit's captaincy for 1st time in 2022, England level series
306.article_body: England defeated India by 100 runs in the second ODI at Lord's to level the three-match series 1-1. This is the first time in 2022 that India have lost an ODI match under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma. Bowling first, India bowled England out for 246 runs in 49 overs. India were bowled out for 146 in 38.5 overs.

307.title: INS 'Dunagiri' to be launched into Hooghly river on Friday: Govt
307.article_body: The Ministry of Defence has stated that INS Dunagiri, a Project 17A frigate, will be launched into the Hooghly river at Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers on Friday. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will be the chief guest for the event. P17A ships are follow-on of the P17 Frigates, with improved stealth features, advanced weapons and sensors and platform management systems.

308.title: Officials in Odisha seize marijuana worth ₹8 lakh, arrest one
308.article_body: In Odisha's Berhampur town, a team of excise department officials seized marijuana worth ₹8 lakh and arrested one person in connection with the case, an official said. Intelligence and enforcement bureau wing officials from the department acted on a tip-off and intercepted a vehicle from which they recovered 160 kg of marijuana. The driver of the vehicle was arrested.

309.title: Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee calls Biden's Saudi trip 'heartbreaking'
309.article_body: Murdered Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee Hatice Cengiz called US President Joe Biden's upcoming visit to Saudi Arabia "heartbreaking", saying Biden was backing down from his promise to defend human rights. Biden on Friday will meet Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who has denied any knowledge or involvement in Khashoggi's 2018 killing.

310.title: Guru Granth Sahib insulted at Punjab CM Mann's marriage ceremony: SGPC
310.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) has claimed that the vehicle carrying holy book Guru Granth Sahib was stopped for inspection at Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony. The committee called the act an "insult to the honour of the Guru". "It was even more hurtful that this incident took place at [CM's] residence," SGPC chief Harjinder Singh Dhami said.

311.title: 5 drug peddlers arrested in Bengaluru; 5 kg hashish oil seized
311.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers, including two women, were arrested in Bengaluru and 5 kg hashish oil worth ₹4 crore and 6 kg marijuana was seized from them, Karnataka Police said. Calling it an inter-state racket, Joint Commissioner of Police Raman Gupta said the accused had connections with drug smugglers in Bengaluru, Kochi, Chennai, Hyderabad and Mumbai.

312.title: Piyush Goyal reappointed Leader of House in Rajya Sabha
312.article_body: Following his election to the Parliament for a third term, Union Minister of Commerce and Industry, Piyush Goyal has been reappointed as the Leader of the House in the Rajya Sabha. The BJP has communicated its choice to the Rajya Sabha Chairman, Venkaiah Naidu. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had appointed Goyal as the leader of the Rajya Sabha in 2021.

313.title: Tripura CM sends 100 boxes of pineapples to Bangladeshi PM
313.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha on Thursday sent 100 boxes of pineapples to Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina as part of a goodwill gesture. The move is also aimed at promoting Tripura's best horticultural crop in Bangladesh, a senior state government official said. Earlier, PM Hasina had sent 600 kgs of mangoes to Saha.

314.title: Japan warns of fresh COVID-19 wave
314.article_body: Japan on Thursday warned of a fresh COVID-19 wave as the country records a surge in new cases. On Wednesday, Tokyo registered 16,878 fresh cases, the highest count since February this year. "The coronavirus is spreading... through all age groups," Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said, urging citizens to get the booster shots.

315.title: Italian PM Mario Draghi says he will resign despite winning confidence vote
315.article_body: Italy's PM Mario Draghi on Thursday said he'll resign amid a political crisis. Draghi survived a no-confidence vote in the Italian Senate, yet his government's future was thrown into question due to a boycott of the vote by the populist Five Star Movement, a key coalition ally. "The national unity coalition that backed this government no longer exists," he said.

316.title: Khloe & her ex-boyfriend Tristan expecting 2nd child via surrogate: Reports
316.article_body: American television personality Khloe Kardashian and her ex-boyfriend Tristan Thompson are reportedly expecting a child together via surrogate. In a statement to People, Khloe's reps confirmed she and Tristan are having another baby and said, "We can confirm True will have a sibling who was conceived in November...We'd like to ask for...privacy so that Khloe can focus on her family."

317.title: Marathi actress accused of extortion ends hunger strike in jail
317.article_body: Marathi actress Shraddha Mangle, one of the accused in IAS officer Radheshyam Mopalwar's extortion case, ended her hunger strike in Thane jail on Thursday. The judge who is conducting her trial had convinced her to end the strike. Earlier, her advocate said that she started the strike on June 15, 2022. Mangle has been in the Thane jail since 2018.

318.title: Pak army officer found shot dead, militant group claims responsibility
318.article_body: Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) claimed that it had kidnapped and killed a senior Pakistani army officer and his friend. Bodies of the two men were found in the Balochistan province on Thursday. The officer and his friend were kidnapped while they were on their way to Quetta city from Ziarat, a hill station, on Tuesday, a security official said.

319.title: Southern African countries extend troop deployment in Mozambique
319.article_body: The Southern African Development Community on Thursday extended its troop deployment in Mozambique by another month to fight an insurgency linked to the Islamic State. The SADC countries sent troops to the region last year and its mandate was set to end this week. The extension was granted ahead of the mid-August SADC Summit to analyse the mission's progress.

320.title: New COVID-19 cases rise for 5th straight week: WHO
320.article_body: The World Health Organization on Thursday said number of new COVID-19 cases worldwide has risen for the fifth consecutive week. Last week, 5.7 million new infections were confirmed, marking a 6% increase, even as the number of deaths was close to last week's figure at 9,800. In the last fortnight, cases surged by 30% driven by the infectious Omicron variant.

321.title: Anti-govt protesters vacate govt buildings in Sri Lanka
321.article_body: Anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka vacated several government buildings, including the President's house and the Prime Minister's office, on Thursday. "We've shown what power of the people can do, but it doesn't mean we have to occupy these places," a protest leader said. However, the protesters said that they will continue to occupy the President's office and Galle Face.

322.title: 2 shark attacks reported on US beaches in 1 day, swimming suspended
322.article_body: At least two shark attacks on US beaches on Wednesday in New York state's Long Island, urging authorities to suspend swimming there. In one incident, a 41-year-old surfer was attacked on his leg, inflicting a four-inch wound, while in the other, a 49-year-old man was bitten on his wrist and buttocks. Neither attack was life-threatening.

323.title: I had nobody to celebrate Ishaqzaade success; mom had passed away: Arjun
323.article_body: Arjun Kapoor said he had nobody to celebrate Ishaqzaade's success. He added while his sister was graduating, his mother passed away and his father was in America with his sister. "[I was] being accepted by the industry and audience and had bonafide mainstream success with my first film but I had nobody to share it with at home," he said.

324.title: Bus carrying Amarnath Yatra pilgrims meets with accident, many injured
324.article_body: A bus carrying around 40 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims collided head-on with a tipper dumper in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Thursday. The driver had reportedly lost control of the bus on the national highway near Nussu Badragund. At least 20 passengers were injured, Times Now reported. However, PTI reported officials as saying that eight pilgrims were injured.

325.title: I have no clue about this: Sushmita's brother after Lalit Modi confirms he's dating her
325.article_body: After former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed he's dating Sushmita Sen, the actress' brother Rajeev Sen said, "I actually have no clue about this." "I'm pleasantly surprised. I will speak to my sister before I say anything...My sister is yet to confirm this from her end, so, I can't comment as of now," he told ETimes.

326.title: Google-backed mental health startup Wysa raises $20 million
326.article_body: Google-backed mental health startup, Wysa, has raised $20 million in its Series B funding round. The round, led by HealthQuad and British International Investment, saw participation from existing investors such as Google Assistant Investments, pi Ventures and others. The platform's services are available to UK's National Health Service (NHS) and the Ministry of Health in Singapore, among others.

327.title: UP policeman tries to kill woman he raped on pretext of marriage
327.article_body: A UP Police sub-inspector was arrested on Thursday for allegedly trying to kill a woman he raped repeatedly on the pretext of marriage, officials said. According to the complainant, the accused introduced himself as Rinku Shukla to her and raped her repeatedly over the last two years. The accused forced her to get multiple abortions, reports said.

328.title: Impostor poses as Chennai mayor to cheat officials; attempt fails
328.article_body: Chennai mayor R Priya has filed a complaint with the police that an impostor tried to cheat Greater Chennai Corporation officials by posing as her on WhatsApp. The accused applied a picture of Priya as the display photo and told the officials to log onto an online gift card website. Zonal officials alerted Priya, following which the complaint was filed.

329.title: Byju's-owned Great Learning falsely advertises IIT-B course, may face legal action
329.article_body: Byju's-owned Great Learning is currently under fire for falsely advertising a Continuing Education and Quality Improvement Programme (CE&QIP) from IIT-Bombay as a Post Graduate Programme. The course alumni are looking to take legal action against the firm. While IIT-Bombay's website described the course as a part of the CE&QIP, Great Learning pamphlets advertised it as a PGP.

330.title: Arunachal Pradesh BJP MLA booked for rape
330.article_body: The police said that they have registered a case against a BJP MLA in Arunachal Pradesh for allegedly raping a woman at his residence in Itanagar. The case was registered at a women police station on Tuesday, the police said. It's condemnable if the alleged crime by the lawmaker is proved true, Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women stated.

331.title: TN class 12 girl dies by suicide after alleging torture from teachers
331.article_body: A class 12 student at a private school in Chinna Salem, Tamil Nadu has died by suicide, alleging torture by two of her teachers. The girl's body was found in the school's hostel building on Wednesday. While the teachers have denied the allegations, the girl's relatives protested on the Kallakurichi-Salem Highway and demanded justice.

332.title: Monsoon Session of Himachal Pradesh Assembly to begin on Aug 10
332.article_body: The Monsoon Session of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly will commence from August 10, an official spokesperson said. The decision was taken by Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur in a Cabinet meeting. The Cabinet recommended to the Governor that the session be held in four sittings from August 10-13 and also decided to fill 500 medical officer posts in Health Department.

333.title: ICC bans Bangladesh pacer Shohidul Islam for 10 months for doping violation
333.article_body: Bangladesh pacer Shohidul Islam has been banned for 10 months by ICC for doping violation. The 10-month suspension has been backdated to May 28, the day he admitted to the offence, meaning he'll be eligible to play from March 28, 2023. Shohidul's urine sample came positive for Clomifene, which is classified as a Specified Substance under WADA's Prohibited List.

334.title: Chhattisgarh govt increases additional excise duty on liquor
334.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government on Thursday increased the additional excise duty on alcoholic beverages in the state. Previously, the additional excise duty was ₹5 per bottle, which will now be ₹10, officials said. The move has been made to meet the excise revenue target of 2022-23 and for other development activities in the state, said State Minister Mohammad Akbar.

335.title: Car rams into autorickshaw on Sohna-Gurgaon road, 3 injured
335.article_body: A car allegedly crashed into an autorickshaw at a flyover on the Sohna-Gurgaon road and injured three people, the police said. The police further added that they were informed about the collision from the emergency response system. One of the injured, Palak, in her complaint said that after the accident the car driver abandoned his vehicle and fled.

336.title: 3 arrested over alleged involvement in 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur
336.article_body: A Special Investigation Team probing the 1984 anti-Sikh riots arrested three people, all aged above 60, on Thursday. They were allegedly part of a mob that had torched houses, killing several people in Kanpur. They've been booked under several sections of the IPC including Section 302 (murder). The SIT has so far arrested 22 people in connection with the riots.

337.title: Affordable healthcare shared responsibility of public & pvt sector: Vice Prez
337.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu said that providing quality and affordable healthcare is the shared responsibility of the private and public sector. Speaking at the Thalassemia and Sickle Cell Society in Hyderabad, he emphasised the need for preventive measures to address the burden of genetic diseases. Lack of awareness of genetic diseases, he said, is a reason they aren't diagnosed early.

338.title: 45 nations pledge to coordinate probes into alleged war crimes in Ukraine
338.article_body: Forty-five countries, including the US, the UK, Canada, Mexico and Australia, on Thursday agreed to coordinate investigations into suspected war crimes in Ukraine. Notably, Russia has repeatedly said that it is not involved in war crimes in Ukraine and also denied deliberately targeting civilians. Currently, there are about 23,000 alleged war crimes being probed in Ukraine.

339.title: No Pakistan connection in suspected terror module in Bihar: Police
339.article_body: After busting a potential terror module in Bihar, police on Thursday said no connection was established between Pakistan or Pakistan-based organisations and the arrested persons. "There's no involvement of any mainstream religious institution. They worked individually, away from the public eye," SSP Manavjit Singh said. Three persons were arrested in a suspected terror module in Patna on Thursday.

340.title: Rishi Sunak tops 2nd round of voting in contest to elect UK's next PM
340.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won the most votes in the second round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as the leader of the Conservative Party and the Prime Minister of the country. Sunak received 101 votes, followed by Penny Mordaunt with 83 votes and Liz Truss with 64 votes. Notably, Indian-origin Suella Braverman was eliminated from the contest.

341.title: Murmu will get more votes than expected in Prez polls: Goa CM
341.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will get more votes than expected as BJP has 'numbers' in the state. "Apart from 25 MLAs, we have appealed to other MLAs too to vote for her," Sawant said. Murmu on Thursday arrived in Goa and sought support from MPs and MLAs for the upcoming Presidential elections.

342.title: Odisha BJP MLAs protest against Cong leader's remarks on Murmu
342.article_body: Odisha BJP MLAs held a protest inside the state Legislative Assembly on Thursday against Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's remarks on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. The BJP also took out a protest rally in Bhubaneswar condemning Ajoy Kumar's statement. Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday alleged that Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India".

343.title: 2 inter-state drug smugglers held in Jammu, 600 kg poppy straw seized
343.article_body: Two alleged inter-state drug smugglers were arrested in Jammu's Sidhra on Thursday and 600 kg of poppy straw was seized from their truck, an officer of the Anti-Narcotic Task Force said. The truck was on its way to Punjab from Kashmir when it was intercepted, the official said. Twenty-four plastic bags containing poppy straw concealed under plywood sheets were recovered.

344.title: Aamir organises special screening of 'Laal...' for Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna
344.article_body: Aamir Khan, who'll be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', hosted a special screening of the film for a few Telugu celebrities including Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, SS Rajamouli, Sukumar and Naga Chaitanya. A picture of Aamir watching 'Laal Singh Chaddha' with Telugu film personalities was shared on social media. It is the Hindi remake of Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump'.

345.title: Charge-sheet filed against 37 accused in Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
345.article_body: The Delhi Police on Thursday filed a charge-sheet against 37 people in the communal clashes that broke out in Jahangirpuri on Hanuman Jayanti in April. The Crime Branch filed a 2,063-page charge-sheet at Rohini Court, which stated that eight accused are still on the run and the others were booked under charges of rioting, arson, attempted murder and criminal conspiracy.

346.title: Lalit Modi's 9-year-old 'Reply my SMS' tweet to Sushmita Sen goes viral
346.article_body: After former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed that he is dating Sushmita Sen, his nine-year-old 'Reply my SMS' tweet to the actress has gone viral. "So this is where it all started," a Twitter user wrote. "God works in mysterious ways," another user commented on the viral tweet. Another user wrote, "Taking notes right now."

347.title: This 60-65 kg boy lifted 100 kg, he did it on his own: Sukhwinder on Ranbir
347.article_body: Sukhwinder Singh who's a part of 'Shamshera' praised Ranbir Kapoor in an interview. He said, "When I went on...sets [of Shamshera], there was a fight sequence and I saw that Ranbir...sahab, this boy, was doing everything on his own with his...physical effort." "This 60-65 kg boy was lifting 100 kg guys and there were no special effects," he added.

348.title: Viral pic shows crab with human-like teeth in Russia
348.article_body: A photograph of a crab, that appears to have 'human-like teeth', has gone viral. The picture has been shared by Roman Fedortsov, who works on a fishing vessel in Western Russia, on Instagram. "That's human teeth. Tell me I'm wrong," a comment read while another person commented, "Looks like a Pokémon in the final stage of being beaten in battle."

349.title: IT Department raids Cong MLA Sanjay Sharma's bungalow, sugar mill
349.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting search operations at premises linked to Sanjay Sharma, a Congress MLA from Tendukheda. The MLA is reportedly a liquor and sand baron in Madhya Pradesh. The search action covered 44 premises including Sharma's bungalow in Jabalpur and a sugar mill in Narsinghpur. As per reports, documents related to income tax evasion have been seized.

350.title: Being below poverty line no exception for not abiding by rule of law: SC
