350.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday said that being below the poverty line is "not an exception" to not abide by the rule of law which has to be adhered to by all concerned. "When the Constitution recognises rule of law, it has to be adhered to by one and all," said a bench of Justices AM Khanwilakar and JB Pardiwala.

351.title: BJP running 'Operation Kamal' in Prez polls, bribing people: Sinha
351.article_body: Ahead of Presidential elections, opposition parties’ Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has accused the BJP of carrying out 'Operation Kamal' by engaging in horse-trading. Sinha, who has sought a probe into the matter, alleged that the party is offering a "huge sum of money to non-BJP MLAs" to back NDA's candidate in polls. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.

352.title: German regulator warns electricity bills could triple
352.article_body: Germany's energy regulator has said electricity bills are expected to triple in the coming year as there were reductions on gas imports from Russia due to its invasion of Ukraine. Chief of Federal Network Agency Klaus Müller said the market price for electricity had increased sevenfold in some cases. He said households must make financial preparations for the future.

353.title: AI startup Detect Technologies raises $28 mn in Series B round
353.article_body: Artificial Intelligence-based software-as-a-service (Saas) firm Detect Technologies has raised $28 million in its Series B funding round. Led by Prosus Ventures, the round saw participation from existing investors Accel, Elevation Capital, Shell Ventures, among others. The startup provides industries with cloud-based applications to enhance visibility of industrial risks and improve productivity.

354.title: Fire breaks out at hotel in Delhi's Paharganj, 10 rescued
354.article_body: A fire broke out at a hotel in Delhi's Paharganj area, on Thursday morning, officials said. Ten people were rescued from the fire that broke out on the second floor of the Roma Delux hotel in Paharganj, and no casualties were reported. The owner of the hotel, Ritik Kapoor, said that the fire was triggered due to a short circuit.

355.title: My dad & brother were confident about me doing Gupt with Rajiv Rai: Bobby
355.article_body: As film 'Gupt' clocked 25 years, actor Bobby Deol said his father Dharmendra and brother Sunny Deol were confident of him working with Rajiv Rai. "My brother had already worked with Rajiv and my father had already worked with Rajiv's dad in earlier films," he added. "They knew...their son and their brother was in safe hands," Bobby said.

356.title: Nepal Parliament's lower house passes 1st Citizenship Amendment Bill
356.article_body: The lower house of Nepal's Parliament on Wednesday passed the country's first Citizenship Amendment Bill. The bill has been introduced to make Nepal's citizenship process more inclusive, according to Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand. Notably, the bill was under discussion for more than two years due to a lack of political consensus over it.

357.title: Russian missile strikes on Ukrainian city kill 21 people: Officials
357.article_body: Russian missile strikes on the Ukrainian city of Vinnytsia on Thursday have killed at least 21 people, including three children, according to officials. The missile strikes were launched from a Russian submarine in the Black Sea, Ukraine claimed. "What is this, if not an open act of terrorism?" Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

358.title: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirms he is dating Sushmita Sen, shares pics
358.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has revealed he's dating actress Sushmita Sen. Sharing pictures, he tweeted, "Just back in London after a whirling global tour...with the families...not to mention my better half Sushmita Sen...a new beginning a new life finally. Over the moon." He further tweeted, "Just for clarity. Not married...just dating each other. That too...will happen one day."

359.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa resigns after arriving in Singapore
359.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has resigned after landing in Singapore. "The Speaker of Sri Lanka's Parliament has received President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation letter," Sri Lankan Speaker's office said. The Singapore government has said Rajapaksa is on a "private visit" and has not asked for asylum and neither has he been granted any asylum.

360.title: 'I2U2' nations want to combine resources to propel growth: Israel PM
360.article_body: Speaking at the first I2U2 (India-Israel-UAE-US) summit, Israeli PM Yair Lapid said that the member countries share a common vision wherein they want to combine resources to propel growth. "It's clear that all want the same thing including infrastructure development, quality education... and [environmental conservation]," Lapid said. "We want to change the world for the better," he added.

361.title: Bengal CM Mamata prepares momos at Darjeeling stall; video surfaces
361.article_body: A video that has surfaced on social media shows West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee preparing momos at a roadside shop in Darjeeling. The video shows Banerjee flattening the dough and stuffing it. "Darjeeling will always have my heart and I salute the hard-working people of our hills who make every visit so memorable," she wrote on Facebook.

362.title: UAE to invest $2 bn to develop integrated food parks across India
362.article_body: The United Arab Emirates will invest $2 billion to develop a series of integrated food parks across India, according to the joint statement issued by four-nation grouping I2U2 (India, Israel, the UAE and the US). This is a part of I2U2's efforts to tackle the food insecurity in South Asia and Middle East. India will provide land for the project.

363.title: Lata Mangeshkar's family to set up old-age home for artists in Nashik
363.article_body: Late singer Lata Mangeshkar's family will set up an old-age home for artists in Nashik. The singer had registered the foundation herself in July 2021. "It was Lata Didi's vision to help and heal elderly artists who are either abandoned by their children or feel financially helpless to sustain their lives," the family said in the statement.

364.title: India's first monkeypox case reported in Kerala
364.article_body: India on Thursday confirmed its first monkeypox case in Kerala. The person is a traveller from UAE and reached the state on July 12. "He reached Trivandrum airport and all the steps are being taken as per the guidelines issued by WHO and ICMR," said Kerala Health Minister Veena George.

365.title: What a waste of time, energy & money: Mahindra on fallout of Elon Musk-Twitter deal
365.article_body: Anand Mahindra has commented on the fallout of the $44-billion deal between Elon Musk and Twitter. "What a waste of time, energy & money," he wrote. He added, "Twitter's an indispensable source of news and connectedness. Can it be run like a quasi social enterprise...listed, for profit...but with...strong charter & managed by...board with directors who act responsibly like trustees?"

366.title: Inadequate police cover led to Shinzo Abe's death: Japan PM
366.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Thursday said inadequate police cover led to the death of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. "I urge them (police) to fix what needs to be fixed, while also studying examples in other countries," Kishida said. Abe, who was Japan's longest serving Prime Minister, was assassinated in western Japan last Friday.

367.title: I worked as spot boy at 17 after my father fell sick: Anil Kapoor
367.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, who recently completed 39 years as an actor in Bollywood, has recalled the beginning of his career when he used to work as a spot boy at the age of 17. "We came to know he (father) has heart issues," he added. "I...loved waking up...actors...fetching them from the airport [and] dropping them to the location," he said.

368.title: UP govt bans sale of liquor, meat on routes used for Kanwar Yatra
368.article_body: The UP government has banned the sale of liquor and meat on routes being used for Kanwar Yatra and enhanced security arrangements along the routes for the safety of Kanwariyas. Additionally, no transportation of meat or animal carcasses will be allowed on those routes. Notably, neighbouring Uttarakhand has barred Kanwariyas from carrying swords, tridents and other harmful objects.

369.title: ISIS claims responsibility for fatal attack on J&K ASI, releases video
369.article_body: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday which left Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Mushtaq Ahmad dead. Amaq, the propaganda group of ISIS, has released a 40-second purported body camera footage where an attacker is seen carrying a pistol and opening fire at policemen while raising slogans such as "Allah-o-Akbar" and "Lailaha-illallah".

370.title: Principals of two Bengaluru schools suspended
370.article_body: The principals of Bishop Cotton Boys' School and St John's High School in Bengaluru have been suspended over allegations of not following due processes, the Karnataka Central Diocese has said without elaborating on the accusations. The Diocese has formed a three-member committee to probe the allegations and will issue a statement thereafter. Both schools are over 160 years old.

371.title: After expelling O Panneerselvam, AIADMK sacks his sons & 16 supporters
371.article_body: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday expelled O Panneerselvam's sons and 16 other supporters of the ousted leader from the party. This comes days after the AIADMK expelled Panneerselvam. AIADMK on Monday elected Palaniswami as its Interim General Secretary and vested in him full powers to head the organisation.

372.title: Rescue operations almost ended: J&K LG on Amarnath cloudburst
372.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha said the rescue operations after the cloudburst near the Amarnath cave have "almost ended". Every pilgrim is insured with ₹5 lakh and the shrine board has decided to provide additional ₹5 lakh to the families of the deceased, Sinha said. At least 16 people were killed after a cloudburst near Amarnath cave last week.

373.title: Class 12 school student arrested for stabbing classmates in Delhi
373.article_body: A class 12 student was arrested for allegedly stabbing his classmates following a quarrel at a government school in Delhi's Bhati Mines area, police said on Thursday. Mohit (accused) attacked Ankush (victim) with a knife when an argument broke out between the two, DCP (south) Benita Mary Jaiker said. Mohit attacked two other classmates when they intervened, she added.

374.title: Chhattisgarh man kills girlfriend with hammer suspecting infidelity
374.article_body: A 28-year-old man died by suicide after allegedly killing his girlfriend with a hammer and a blade over suspicion of infidelity in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said on Wednesday. The accused attacked his girlfriend with a hammer and blade at her rented house, before taking the extreme step, ASP (west) Akash Rao Giripunje said.

375.title: Aamir to appear as special guest on Big B's Kaun Banega Crorepati 14: Reports
375.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan will reportedly be joining Amitabh Bachchan for the first episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 14. According to reports, the first episode will see a few real-life heroes, from sports stars to army officers and policemen. Reports added that Aamir Khan will also be seen talking about his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in the episode.

376.title: 90% work of Mopa airport complete, commissioning after Aug 15: Goa CM
376.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that about 90% work of the Mopa International Airport in the state has been completed. The airport in North Goa district would be commissioned between August 15 and September 1 this year, Sawant said. A skill development centre has started operating at the site where students are being trained for employment, he added.

377.title: Five killed as car rams into a tree in Haryana's Narnaul
377.article_body: Police on Thursday said that five people were killed after the car in which they were travelling rammed into a tree near the Raghunathpura bypass in Haryana's Narnaul. "The car hit a tree along the road," Narnaul city police station SHO Santosh Kumar said. The deceased were in the mid-30 to mid-50 age group, Kumar added.

378.title: Land allotted to build equivalent of IIT in Pak turns into 'bakra mandi'
378.article_body: Dr Umar Saif, ex-Vice-Chancellor of Pakistan's Information Technology University, revealed that the land allotted for the construction of an equivalent of IIT in Pakistan has turned into a 'bakra mandi'. He tweeted that the land was kept aside for the construction of the institute in 2013. He shared pictures from the site, showing how the area has turned into marketplace.

379.title: Sri Lanka President allowed entry on private visit, hasn't been granted asylum: Singapore
379.article_body: Singapore government has confirmed that Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has been allowed entry on a "private visit". "He has not asked for asylum and neither has he been granted any asylum. Singapore generally does not grant requests for asylum," said Singapore government. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was named acting President after Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka.

380.title: MCD issues notices to 40,000 Delhi residents over property tax
380.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has issued notices to around 40,000 residents whose property tax records of any financial year or payment receipts are not available with the MCD, officials said on Wednesday. Notably, some of the residents have been asked to furnish tax receipts dating as far back as 2004. AAP has called for the notices to be withdrawn.

381.title: Drug peddler arrested with marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh in Pune
381.article_body: Pune Police on Wednesday arrested a drug peddler who was caught with 23.6 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh. The accused, identified as Suraj Kantilal Bora, was nabbed at Lonikand after the anti-narcotics cell of the Pune Police received a tip-off on his whereabouts. Bora has been booked under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

382.title: Rupee drops 9 paise to close at all-time low of 79.90 against US dollar
382.article_body: The rupee declined by 9 paise to close at a new record low of 79.90 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 79.72 and witnessed intra-day high of 79.71 and a low of 79.92 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, dropped 2.20% to $97.38/barrel.

383.title: Ruraltech startup FAARMS raises $10 mn in a funding round
383.article_body: Ruraltech startup FAARMS has raised $10 million in a recent funding round. The round was led by Dr Cornelius Boersch, Founder of Conny & Co., Singaporean angel investor Koh Boon Hwee, and saw participation from Apoorva Ranjan Sharma, Co-founder of Venture Catalysts and 9 Unicorns, among others. The Bengaluru-based startup was founded by Taranbir Singh and Alok Duggal in 2020.

384.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires recruitment company WOLVES
384.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's subsidiary, upGrad Rekrut, has acquired Bengaluru-based recruitment and staffing firm WOLVES, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2014, WOLVES India places tech talent across startups, along with mid-size and large organisations and has closed over 5,000 placements till date. WOLVES India will operate independently as a subsidiary of upGrad Rekrut, as per a statement.

385.title: Twitter down for thousands of users across the globe
385.article_body: Twitter is down for thousands of users across the globe, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issues started with the service at around 5:40 pm IST, with a lot of users reporting 'over capacity' error messages. It is the first major Twitter outage since February, as per The Verge.

386.title: Will is apologetic: Kevin on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy at Oscars
386.article_body: Actor Will Smith's friend Kevin Hart opened up about how Will is doing after the slap controversy. He said that Will is "apologetic and he's in a "better space". "I can...hope that the two of them find a way to find some solace in that and move past it," he added. "Ultimately, life goes on and people grow," Kevin said.

387.title: Centre upgrades security of Kumar Vishwas to Y+ category
387.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has upgraded the security of former Aam Aadmi Party leader Kumar Vishwas from Y to Y+ category, ANI reported. The decision is based on a threat assessment report by Intelligence Bureau. In February, the Centre had granted Y security cover to Vishwas after he accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of having links with separatist outfits.

388.title: ₹229 crore allotted to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru
388.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will spend ₹229 crore to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru, as concretisation threatens its water resources. While the detailed project reports (DPRs) for 10 lakes have been prepared, the civic body is calling for public suggestions to complete the remaining DPRs. Citizens have demanded the DPRs be prepared online to maintain transparency.

389.title: Bhutan to reopen for foreign tourists from Sept, will triple entry fees
389.article_body: Bhutan will reopen its borders to foreign tourists for first time since pandemic broke out in 2020 from September 23 onwards. Bhutan will hike its sustainable development fees, which is mandatory to enter country, from $65 (over ₹5,000) per night, per person to $200 (over ₹15,000). "COVID-19 has allowed us to...rethink how [tourism] sector can be best...operated," Foreign Minister said.

390.title: Removing gangster culture, curbing drug menace priority: Punjab DGP
390.article_body: Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav on Thursday said eliminating gangster culture and controlling the drug menace are the top priorities of the state police. The state police is committed to maintaining law and order, he said, asserting that the Punjab Police is one of the best police forces in the world. We will ensure people-friendly police, he added.

391.title: Don't want to be on another platform: Ranbir on staying away from social media
391.article_body: When asked why he is not there on social media, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "I don’t want to be on another platform and put in hard work and show my personality there." "I am a film actor and would love to remain so," he added. On the professional front, Ranbir will be next seen in the film 'Shamshera'.

392.title: No word has been banned, clarifies Lok Sabha Speaker on 'unparliamentary' words
392.article_body: Amid criticism over a list of words deemed unfit for Parliament that included terms like 'corrupt' and 'incompetent', Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said no word had been "banned". "We've issued a compilation of...words that have been expunged," Birla added. "Earlier a book of...unparliamentary words used to be released...To avoid wastage of papers, we've put it on internet," he stated.

393.title: CAQM frames new policy to fight air pollution in Delhi-NCR
393.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Wednesday unveiled a new policy to curb air pollution in Delhi and National Capital Region (NCR). The policy lists sector-wise action plans to reduce air pollution in the next five years. One of the measures the policy suggests is the phasing out of diesel-run auto-rickshaws in NCR by December 31, 2026.

394.title: SIT gets 4 more days to interrogate 4 Moosewala killing suspects
394.article_body: Punjab Police's Special Investigation Team (SIT) has received four more days to interrogate four suspects, including two shooters, over the murder of Sidhu Moosewala. This comes as a Mansa court on Wednesday extended the police remand for these suspects till Sunday. The SIT had said that their further custodial interrogation is required to recover the weapons used in the crime.

395.title: Did films where my heart wasn't there, won't do them again: Rajkummar
395.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he did one or two films, where his heart wasn't there and he'll not be doing that anymore. "I want to go back home after a day's work and think 'you know, I did something good today'," he added. "I want to feel content doing that job. So I'm gonna...be in that process forever," he said.

396.title: IRCTC offers 6-day tour package to Nepal from Aug 8, starting at ₹38,400
396.article_body: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced a six-day and five-night air package for Nepal, starting at ₹38,400 per person. The tourists will get to cover Pashupatinath Temple, Patan and Durbar Square, among other locations, during the journey, which will commence on August 8. The flight will depart at 7:45 am from Madhya Pradesh’s Bhopal airport.

397.title: Daler Mehndi arrested after court upholds 2-year sentence in human trafficking case
397.article_body: Singer Daler Mehndi has been arrested and sent to jail after a Patiala court on Thursday dismissed the appeal filed by him against his two-year jail sentence in a human trafficking case registered against him in 2003. Daler and his brother were sentenced to two years in jail in 2018, following which they were granted bail.

398.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against England, Virat Kohli returns
398.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the second ODI at Lord's. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli replacing Shreyas Iyer. Kohli had missed the first ODI due to a groin strain. England are fielding an unchanged playing XI.

399.title: Pakistan will be more challenging than Australia: SL captain Karunaratne
399.article_body: Sri Lanka's Test captain Dimuth Karunaratne said it will be "more challenging" for his team to face Pakistan in their upcoming two-match Test series, in comparison to the recently concluded Test series against Australia which ended 1-1. "Pakistan's...a brilliant team...They play spin well," added Karunaratne. "Playing at the same venue three times is a big advantage for us," he stated.

400.title: Over 5 crore pilgrims expected in U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM Dhami
400.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said that the state is expecting a footfall of more than five crore pilgrims during the Kanwar Yatra this year. "We have made all the arrangements regarding the smooth conduct and safety during the Kanwar Yatra," he said. "We appeal to them to follow the rules made by the administration," Dhami added.

401.title: Wall collapses on labourers amid heavy rains in Gujarat, 3 killed
401.article_body: Two women labourers and a 16-year-old girl were killed after a boundary wall near an under-construction site collapsed on them amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Thursday. A total of five workers were injured in the incident. Ahmedabad recorded an average rainfall of 27 mm in the morning hours.

402.title: Not Chinese people, some Chinese hardliners consider me separatist: Dalai Lama
402.article_body: The Dalai Lama on Thursday said not Chinese people but some Chinese "hardliners" consider him a separatist. "Now, more and more Chinese are realising that Dalai Lama is not seeking independence but within China meaningful autonomy and to preserve Tibetan Buddhist culture," he said in Jammu. He will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on Friday.
